I HAVE HAD PROBLEMS WITH GETTING THIS CAR (1991 LINCOLN TOWN CAR) THROUGH INSPECTION OVER THE LAST 3 YEARS, DUE TO SMOKING BECAUSE OF EMISSIONS PROBLEMS.  THE CAR HAD LESS THAN 100,000 MILES ON IT WHEN THIS PROBLEM STARTED, AND NOW HAS APPROXIMATELY 119,000 MILES ON IT.  THIS YEAR, I HAVE MADE 4 ATTEMPTS TO GET THE CAR TO PASS THE INSPECTION, HOWEVER IT HAS FAILED DUE TO THE SAME PROBLEM EACH TIME.  I HAVE TAKEN THE CAR TO MECHANICS, AND HAVE BEEN TOLD THAT THIS IS A MANUFACTURERS' DEFECT WITH THESE PARTICULAR CARS.  THEY STATE THAT THE VALVE SEALS GET HARD BECAUSE OF A FACTORY DEFECT AND NEED TO BE REPLACED.  HARDENED  VALVE SEALS ALLOW OIL TO BY-PASS THE VALVE SEALS AND CAUSE THE CARS TO SMOKE.  I FEEL THAT THE MANUFACTURER SHOULD REPLACE THE VALVE SEALS IN MY CAR, AND CORRECT THIS PROBLEM.  I WOULD LIKE TO KEEP THIS CAR, IF YOU CAN PLEASE STOP THE SMOKING, IT IS A GOOD CAR!  THANK YOU VERY MUCH.

DT: 1991 FORD LINCOLN TOWN CAR.  WHILE  DRIVING THE CAR TURNED ON THE AIR CONDITIONING AND ABOUT 15 TO 20 MINUTES LATER SAW FIRE COMING OUT FROM UNDERNEATH THE HOOD, SURROUNDING THE RIGHT FRONT WHEEL.   PULLED OFF THE ROAD, BY THAT TIME THE CAR HAD A LARGE FIRE.  THE CONSUMER PUT THE FIRE OUT BY THROWING WATER ON IT. AFTER LOOKING AT THE CAR SAW THAT ALL THE WIRES WERE MELTED AROUND WHERE THE WHEEL WAS,  AND  ALSO THERE WAS  A MELTED RUBBER.   A FRIEND INSPECTED THE CAR.  HE CUT A WIRE THAT LET THE CONSUMER  DRIVE THE CAR HOME. WHERE IT WAS PARKED.   THERE WAS  A SHORT CIRCUIT IN THE WIRING SYSTEM.  THE CAR HAS NOT BEEN REPAIRED. *AK

DT: THE CONTACT STATED  1991 LINCOLN TOWN CAR HAD ONLY 17,000 MILES ON IT. ON 8-25-05 HE FELT LIKE HIS BRAKES WERE LOW. HE WENT TO HAVE THEM INSPECTED AND THE CAR PASSED THE INSPECTION,  BUT HE HAD THE BRAKES CHANGED ANYWAY. HE SMELLED THE BRAKES BURNING THAT DAY AS HE WAS DRIVING HOME FROM THE GARAGE. HE PARKED THE CAR IN THE GARAGE ,AND DID NOT DRIVE THE CAR UNTIL ABOUT A MONTH LATER WHEN HE SMELLED WHAT HE THOUGHT WAS THE BRAKES BURNING AGAIN. WHEN HE GOT IN TO  DRIVEWAY, HE SAW FIRE UNDER THE WHEELS. HE PUT THE FIRE OUT WITH A FIRE EXTINGUISHER. HAD HE NOT HAD THE FIRE EXTINGUISHER THE CAR WOULD HAVE BLOWN UP. THE GARAGE THAT FIXED THE BRAKES SAID THE CALIPER HUNG UP AND THAT WAS WHY THE FIRE HAPPENED. ALSO,   THE CONSUMER THOUGHT THIS MAY BE A DEFECT IN THE DESIGN OF THE BRAKES THAT WOULD CAUSE THE CAR TO CATCH ON FIRE OR DID NOT FIX THE BRAKES PROPERLY. HE CALLED FORD, AND THEY TOLD HIM THAT WITHOUT A WARRANTY  THEY DID NOT KNOW WHAT THEY COULD DO, AND THEN  THEY TOLD HIM THEY WOULD SUBMIT HIS COMPLAINT TO THE ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT. THE CONTACT WAS  NOT SURE IF THE CAR HAD ABS BRAKES BECAUSE THE CAR WAS A 1991 MODEL. HE THOUGHT IT DID BUT WAS NOT SURE. HE WAS THE ORIGINAL OWNER OF THE CAR. *AK

DRIVING ON EXPRESSWAY @ 55 MPH ( WINDY WITH 30 MPH GUSTS )  HOOD OPENED AND FOLDED UP OVER THE ROOF  BOTH HOOD LATCHES WERE STILL LOCKED TO THE STRIKE PLATE FROM HOOD  LUCKILY WAS ABLE TO PULL OVER TO THE EMERGENCY LANE  REPLACED HOOD AND STRUTS WITH USED ONES ( FROM A 1993 / SAFER? )  STILL HAVE OLD HOOD AND PLATE AVAILABLE.  *JB

WHILE TRAVELING AT APPROX. 35 MILES PER HOUR ON A LOCAL BRIDGE, MY RIGHT REAR TIRE BLEW OUT. I DROVE A DISTANCE OF SEVERAL YARDS TO THE END OF THE BRIDGE WHERE I WAS ABLE TO PULL TO THE SHOULDER AND STOP. WHEN A VERY KIND POLICE OFFICER TRIED TO REMOVE THE DAMAGED TIRE, HE HAD TO STOP BECAUSE THE TIRE HAD SEPARATED LIKE A RECAPPED TIRE AND WOUND THE TORN PART AROUND THE BRAKE LINES AND AXLE. THE DAMAGES AND SERVICE CHARGES ARE ESTIMATED TO BE MORE THAN SIX HUNDRED DOLLARS. INITIALLY, THE SERVICE REPAIRMAN AT THE TIRE STORE (WHERE ALL OF THE TIRES WERE PURCHASED AND MOUNTED) INDICATED THAT ALL FOUR TIRES NEEDED TO BE REPLACED BECAUSE THEY SHOWED SIGNS OF "DRY-ROT." A SHORT TIME LATER, ANOTHER WORKER SAID ONLY THE DAMAGED TIRE NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THERE SEEMS TO BE SOME PROBLEMS WITH MICHELIN TIRES SOLD WITHIN THE LAST FEW YEARS.  *TR

Summary: I BOUGHT THIS CAR AT THIS DEALERSHIP ON 1-9-03,SINCE I HAVE HAD THIS CAR I HAVE ONLY DRIVEN IT A COUPLE OF TIMES TO DATE. I HAVE TRIED TO TELL THE OWNER OF THE DEALERSHIP AND HE TELLS ME IT'S JUST MY IMAGINATION....HE GOT ANGRY AFTER I CALLED HIM SO MUCH TWO WEEKS AGO THAT HE TOLD ME TO BRING THE CAR IN SO HE CAN LOOK AT IT,I DID AND HE THEN SAID HE NEEDED TO SEND IT AWAY TO HAVE IT LOOKED AT BY OTHER MECHANICS.....HE KEPT MY CAR FOR 8 DAYS THAN BROUGHT IT BACK AND SAID NO ONE COULD FIND ANYTHING WRONG WITH IT AND THAT IT HAD BEEN PUT ON A DIAGNOSTIC MACHINE,I SAID FINE AND COULD I SEE THE PAPERWORK TO THAT EFFECT .....HE REFUSED AND SAID HE DIDN'T HAVE TO BECAUSE IT WAS HIS PAPERWORK,I DIDN'T UNDERSTAND BECAUSE TO ME IF IT HAD REALLY BEEN CHECKED WHY SHOULDN'T I BE ABLE TO SEE EXACTLY WHAT THEY FOUND?.  THIS DEALERSHIP HAS HAD THREE COMPLAINTS AGAINST IT IN THE PAST 36 MONTHS FROM THE BBB.  YOU MAY NOT BE ABLE TO HELP ME BUT PLEASE INVESTIGATE THIS PLACE.....THEY'RE SELLING CARS THAT ARE UNSAFE AND GETTING AWAY WITH IT,I HAVE CALLED THE CITY OF ANTIOCH AND EXPLAINED MY POSITION TO THEM....SOME ONE HAS TO BE RESPONSIBLE FOR A BUSINESS LIKE THIS BEING IN EXISTENCE,AND SOMEONE WILL HAVE TO ANSWER IF DEATH OR INJURY OCCUR BECAUSE THIS MAN WAS ALLOWED TO SELL THESE UNSAFE CARS.

AT THE TIME I HAD THIS COMPONENT FAILURE, I DID NOT KNOW WHAT THE PROBLEM WAS.  I TOOK THIS VEHICLE TO AN AUTHORIZED MAZDA DEALER WHO PROCEEDED TO TAKE A FULL 10 MINUTES TO LOOK AT THIS VEHICLE AND TELL ME THERE WAS NOT A PROBLEM WITH IT.  I PREVIOUSLY FILED A COMPLAINT AND TO MY KNOWLEDGE DID NOT RECEIVE ANY FEEDBACK.  DURING THE TIME I HAD THIS FAILED COMPONENT ON MY FUEL SYSTEM, I DEVELOPED A CHRONIC ASTHMA CONDITION.  ANOTHER DEALER FINALLY FOUND A CRACK IN THE FUEL VAPOR SEPARATOR ONE YEAR LATER WHEN I TOOK THIS VEHICLE BACK FOR ANOTHER INSPECTION.  IT TOOK 4 MONTHS AFTER THE SECOND MAZDA DEALER FOUND THE CRACK FOR ME TO OBTAIN A REPLACEMENT PART FOR THE FAILED COMPONENT.  THE DEALER NEVER INFORMED ME IT WAS UNSAFE TO CONTINUE DRIVING THIS CAR REEKING OF FUEL ODORS.  I WOULD LIKE AN INVESTIGATION TO BE CONDUCTED ON A FORMAL LEVEL.  I BELIEVE MAZDA FAILED TO INFORM THEIR CUSTOMERS OF DANGERS ASSOCIATED WITH DRIVING A CAR THAT MAY HAVE FUEL VAPORS LEAKING INTO THE PASSENGER COMPARTMENT OF THE VEHICLE.  I BELIEVE THE AUTHOIRZED DEALER FAILED TO WARN OF THE POTENTIAL DANGERS OF FUEL ODORS IN THE PASSENGER COMPARTMENT OF THE VEHICLE.  IT SEEMS BY READING THE RECALL LETTERS ISSUED IN APRIL 1998 AND JAN 1999 THAT THE FIRST LETTER REFLECTED AN ATTITUDE OF NONCHALANCE, AND MAZDA IMPLIED THAT THERE WAS REALLY NO CAUSE FOR CONCERN, OR TRUE BELIEF THAT THIS RECALL SHOULD BE TAKEN SERIOUSLY.  THOUGH I DID TAKE IT SERIOUSLY AND HAD MY CAR INSPECTED FOR THE FAILED COMPONENT, THE AUTHORIZED MAZDA DEALER DID NOT SEEM CONCERNED THAT I, A CONSUMER IN GOOD FAITH, WAS PLACED IN HARMS WAY.  ALONG WITH MY CHILDREN.  PLEASE RESPOND TO MY REQUEST AND ADVISE IF I NEED TO CHANNEL OR REDIRECT MY EFFORTS TO HAVE THIS INVESTIGATION REQUEST SOMEWHERE ELSE.  SINCERELY,   [XXX]. *AK    PARTS OF THIS DOCUMENT HAVE BEEN REDACTED TO PROTECT PERSONALLY IDENTIFIABLE INFORMATION PURSUANT TO THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. 552(B)(6).

THE ACCIDENT OCCURRED WHILE TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ABOUT 10 MILES SOUTH OF OCALA, FL.  I WAS DRIVING ALONG WHEN THE CAR STARTED SHAKING VIOLENTLY AND MAKING LOUD THUMPING NOISES.  I IMMEDIATELY PULLED OVER AND CHECKED THE TIRES.  THE TREAD HAD COME OFF THE DRIVER'S SIDE REAR TIRE.  THE TIRE WAS STILL INFALTED.  I CHANGED THE TIRE AND PROCEEDED TO MY DESTINATION, TALLAHASSEE, FL.  THE NEXT DAY, I PURCHASED A NEW FIRESTONE TIRE BUT KEPT THE BLOWN TIRE.  I SHOWED IT TO ANOTHER FIRESTONE RETAIL CENTER IN ORLANDO AND THE SALESPERSON SAID IT LOOKED LIKE A CURING DEFECT.  WE SUED FIRESTONE AND THEY SETTLED FOR $1200.00.  THE CAR IS MY FATHER'S BUT I WAS DRIVING IT AT THE TIME OF THE ACCIDENT.  YOU CAN CONTACT ME AT (850) 838-3508.  ASK FOR CRAIG AUBREY.  WE HAVE SINCE GOTTEN RID OF THE TIRE BUT I CAN PROVIDE PHOTE DOCUMENTATION.  I CAN ALSO PROVIDE PAPERWORK FROM THE LAWSUIT AS WELL AS NOTES I WROTE FOLLOWING THE ACCIDENT.  BEFORE WE SETTLED, FIRESTONE TOLD MY FATHER THAT THE TIRE WAS PROBABLY UNDERINFLATED AT THE TIME OF THE ACCIDENT.  I CHECKED THE INFLATION OF THE TIRES PRIOR TO BEGINNING THE TRIP.  THEY WERE INFLATED ACCORDING TO THE PRESSURE RATED ON THE SIDE OF THE TIRE.  FIRESTONE WANTED TO TIRE TO BE SENT TO THEM BUT WE WOULD NOT FEARING THAT THE EVIDENCE MIGHT BE LOST  (MY FATHER IS AN ATTORNEY).( DOT NUMBER:   TIRE SIZE: P235/75R15 )

THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 127,980 AND FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 127,940.

MAZDA'S RX-7 MODEL FC3S FROM MODEL YEAR 1986-1992'S FUEL PULSATION DAMPER HAS AN ISSUE THAT IT WILL LEAK, SINCE THE DEVICE SITS ON TOP OF THE ENGINE SO IF THE TIMING IS RIGHT, AN ENGINE FIRE WILL START. IT IS A VERY WELL KNOWN ISSUE IN THE RX-7 COMMUNITY. IM SURPRISED NO ONE EVER FILED A COMPLAIN OVER THIS. 1986-1988'S FUEL PULSATION DAMPER IS VERY PRONE TO THIS DEFECT, THEY CHANGED THE DESIGN AND USE THEM ON LATER MODEL YEAR OF RX-7 FROM 1989-1992, BUT IT WILL STILL LEAK. *TR

I AM HEAVILY CONCERNED WITH THE MAJOR SAFETY ISSUES OF MY BELOVED MAZDA AND NEED YOUR HELP. MY SEAT BELT RETRACTORS ARE BROKEN (EMERGENCY), THE HORNS DO NOT WORK (EMERGENCY), MY REAR WINDSHIELD WIPER AND FLUIDS DO NOT WORK (VISIBILITY), MY BRAKE LIGHT IS ON(EMERGENCY), AND MY PULSATION DAMPER IS LEAKING FUEL (FIRE HAZARD). I HAVE READ MANY STORIES ABOUT RX7'S THAT WOULD CATCH ON FIRE DUE TO THE FUEL PULSATION DAMPERS LEAKING FUEL ONTO THE ENGINE, EVENTUALLY IGNITING THEIR WHOLE CAR TO ASHES.   *TR

The contact owns a 1991 Mazda RX-7. The contact stated that the front driver's and passenger's side automatic seat belts failed to retract when the doors are opened. The dealer was made aware of the failure and informed the contact that they had the parts to repair the front passenger's side seat belt but not the parts for the front driver's side seat belt. The vehicle was not repaired. The manufacturer was made aware of the failure but provided no assistance. The contact related the failure to NHTSA Campaign Number: 96V173000 (Seat Belts). The failure mileage was approximately 106,000.

My seatbelt motor and rail has a recall that the dealer confirmed it when I took it to them. My seatbelts get stuck sometimes causing safety concerns. The recall sent in 1996 from Mazda states the cable can wear sufficiently that the cable which retracts the buckle assembly will jam in the rail making it inoperative, if a collision the occupants will not be properly restrained.Recall states the dealer will extend warranty and replace shoulder belt rail and motor for the life of the vehicle. I took my car around October of 2021 they had the car and confirmed recall said they will call me when they get the parts, it’s September of 2022 and I haven’t gotten a call from them, when I call they tell me they don’t have them yet or say they know nothing regarding this car. Can someone help me to get this recall taken care of since I still own the car and have safety concerns with the seatbelts. Sometimes they get struck and don’t want to release properly.

1991 560 SEC HAS INTERMITTENT ROUGH IDLE DURING ALL OPERATING TEMPERATURES. AFTER BEING DRIVEN WITH A/C ON FOR ABOUT 8 MILES IN TRAFFIC AND PARKED FOR UNDER TWO HOURS IN HOT WEATHER, CAR FIRST REFUSES TO START - A/C SWITCHED OFF.  THE CAR STARTS AFTER A FEW ATTEMPTS AND HAS EXTREMELY ROUGH IDLE.  START TO DRIVE AND CAR SOON STALLS REFUSING TO START.  A FEW MORE ATTEMPTS, CAR STARTS AND GOES TO EXTREMELY ROUGH IDLE CONDITION.  CAR DRIVES A SHORT DISTANCE AND DIES. AFTER MANY MORE RESTART ATTEMPTS, CAR STARTS GOES TO EXTREMELY ROUGH IDLE. REVVING THE ENGINE TO ABOUT 3000 RPM FOR ABOUT 30 SECONDS SEEMS TO BRING BACK THE NORMAL ROUGH IDLE WITH BETWEEN 2-4 FOUR REVVING ATTEMPTS AND RESULTING REDUCED COOLANT TEMPERATURE.  CAR DRIVES ROUGHLY AND THEN SUDDENLY SMOOTHES OUT. INTERNET INVESTIGATION POINTS TO BIODEGRADABLE WIRING HARNESS.  SEEMS TO BE A MAJOR SAFETY PROBLEM.  LUCKILY THE 18 WHEELER THAT WAS ABOUT TO CRUSH ME DURING THE LAST STALL EPISODE WAS ABLE TO CHANGE LANES JUST IN TIME. THIS DOES NOT HAPPEN IN WINTER TIME.   FOR A CAR THIS EXPENSIVE, THIS IS OUTRAGEOUS.  I NEVER HAD SUCH A SAFETY AND ENGINE FIRE POTENTIAL PROBLEM WITH MY 1982 380SEC.  THE WIRING HARNESS IS AN UNCONSCIONABLE EXPENSIVE ITEM THAT SEEMS TO HAVE THE SAME SERVICE LIFE AS A $30 SERPENTINE BELT, BUT COSTS OVER $1000.  THIS IS ALSO A MAJOR EMISSIONS PROBLEM THAT COULD DESTROY THE EQUALLY EXPENSIVE CONTROL SYSTEMS AND CATALYTIC CONVERTER. DOES SOMEBODY DIE FOR YOU PEOPLE TO DEMAND A RECALL.  OR DOES THE CAR HAVE TO BECOME A SUPER POLLUTER?  I COULD HAVE DIED FROM THIS PROBLEM AND MY CAR IS A SUPER POLLUTER WHEN THIS INTERMITTENT HOT PROBLEM OCCURS.  I'M GOING TO WRITE MY STATE AND FEDERAL REPRESENTATIVES AND SENATORS. DO THE RIGHT THING AND GET THIS PROBLEM FIXED WITH A RECALL.  BIODEGRADABLE WIRING! HOW STUPID IS THAT?  *JB

AS I WAS TURNING A CORNER MY CAR QUIT RUNNING. FURTHER INVESTIGATION  FOUND THAT THERE WAS NO POWER GETTING TO THE FUEL PUMP. THE INERTIA SWITCH HAD MELTED FROM A ELECTRICAL SHORT IN THE SYSTEM. AFTER REMOVING THE FUEL PUMP/SENDING UNIT ASSY. FROM THE GAS TANK, I FOUND THE SHORT  IN THE TANK. THE 12 VOLT POWER SUPPLY THAT RUNS FROM THE TANK WALL PLATE, TO THE FUEL PUMP, RUNS TO CLOSE TO THE SENDING UNIT MOUNTING PLATE NEAR THE FUEL PUMP. OVER TIME, THE STEEL MOUNTING PLATE HAD RUBBED THE SINGAL COAT OF INSULATION FROM THE POWER WIRE. THIS CAUSED A DIRECT SHORT INSIDE THE FUEL TANK. AS A CAR MECHANIC FOR TEN YEARS BEFORE MOVING INTO AIRCRAFT MECHANICS, NO SIGNS WERE EVIDENT OF THE SENDING UNIT ASSY. EVER BEING REMOVED.  *AK

MY INSURANCE COMPANY WILL NOT COVER ANY MORE OF MY MEDICAL BILLS.  I HAVE NOT BEEN ABLE TO WORK SINCE THE ACCIDENT.  I HAD JUST HAD KNEE SURGERY BEFORE THIS HAPPENED.  I AM PERMANENTLY DISABLED. MY CHILDREN AND I WERE ALMOST KILLED RECENTLY WHEN WE WERE DOING 70 MPH ON I-85 AND THE CAR JUST SHUT OFF.  I HAD TALKED WITH MECHANICS IN GERMANY WHEN IT DID IT TO MY HUSBAND ON THE AUTOBAHN ONCE COMING FROM FRANKFURT.  WE WERE TOLD THE CAR REACHES A CERTAIN TEMPERATURE AND HAS AN AUTOMATIC SHUTOFF.  THE TEMPERATURE GAUGE READS NORMAL SO WHY WOULD THE CAR SHUT DOWN AT NORMAL TEMPERATURE.  THIS IS VERY DANGEROUS ESPECIALLY WHEN IT CAN HAPPEN AT INTERSTATE SPEEDS.  I WAS LUCKY I WAS ABLE TO CONTROL THE CAR TO THE SIDE WITH NO POWER STEERING OR BRAKES AND COAST TO A STOP.  AFTER 30 MINUTES OF SITTING THE CAR WILL START AND GO.  IT WILL THEN GET TO THAT TEMPERATURE AND SHUTOFF AGAIN.  AFTER THIS HAPPENED THE FIRST TIME IN GERMANY MY HUSBAND AND I NEVER DROVE THE CAR OF THE MILITARY POST BECAUSE WE WERE AFRAID OF AN ACCIDENT.  WE RECENTLY HAVE COME BACK TO THE STATES AND HAVE TO DO A LOT OF TRAVELING ON THE INTERSTATE, THIS IS WHEN IT HAPPENED AGAIN.  I RECENTLY SAW SEGMENT ON DATELINE OR ONE OF THOSE SHOWS WHERE THIS HAD HAPPENED TO A FORD TAURUS AND EVIDENTLY THE PEOPLE WERE KILLED OR INJURED SERIOUSLY.  WHAT HAD HAPPENED TO MY SABLE WAS THE SAME THING THIS FORD TAURUS WAS EXPERIENCING.  I WOULD APPRECIATE ALL THE HELP IN THE MATTER, AS I CAN'T DRIVE FAR FROM HOME BECAUSE OF THE SERIOUSNESS.

LIFTGATE HAD CHRONIC DIFFICULTY CLOSING SECURELY, BEGINNING AT APPROXIMATELY 50,000 MILES. DEALER ADVISED ME TO ADJUST STRIKER POSITION. EVENTUALLY PROBLEM WORSENED UNTIL LIFTGATE WOULD NOT CLOSE SECURELY DESPITE STRIKER ADJUSTMENT. PLASTIC TRIM PIECE COVERING LIFTGATE STILL WAS REMOVED REVEALING THAT THE SHEET METAL STILL (PART NUMBER 8D74) WAS FRACTURED AROUND THE STRIKER ADJUSTMENT OPENING, CAUSING STRIKER TO MOVE WHEN LIFTGATE WAS CLOSED, PREVENTING LIFTGATE FROM CLOSING AROUND STRIKER. I CALLED DEALER TO ALERT THEM TO THIS DEFECT; DEALER STATED THEY KNEW OF NO TSBS (TECHNICAL SAFETY BULLETINS) ADDRESSING THIS PROBLEM; THEREFORE I WOULD BE RESPONSIBLE FOR REPAIR COSTS. I THEN CALLED FORD-MERCURY CUSTOMER SERVICE; THEY STATED THAT MY CAR WAS OUT OF WARRANTY, AND THAT THERE WERE NO RECALLS FOR THIS PROBLEM; THEREFORE THEIR "FINAL DECISION" WAS THAT THE REPAIR COSTS WERE MY RESPONSIBILITY. (REPAIR COSTS, AS ESTIMATED BY A BODY SHOP, WERE $315.) I SUBMIT THAT THIS IS NOT A NORMAL "WEAR & TEAR" PROBLEM, BUT A SAFETY DEFECT. MY SAFETY CONCERNS: 1/UNSECURED LIFTGATE ALLOWS CARBON MONOXIDE FROM EXHAUST TO ENTER CAR WHILE DRIVING, ENDANGERING ALL OCCUPANTS; 2/UNSECURED LIFTGATE CAN BOUNCE OPEN WHEN DRIVING, ENDGANGERING OCCUPANTS OF REAR-FACING SEAT; 3/UNSECURED LIFTGATE EXPOSES CONTENTS OF PARKED CAR, AND CAR ITSELF, TO THEFT. I AM CERTAIN THAT THIS IS A COMMON PROBLEM FOR THIS MAKE AND MODEL OF VEHICLE. FORD-MERCURY WAS QUITE UNRESPONSIVE AND INDIFFERENT ABOUT ADDRESSING AND CORRECTING THIS SAFETY DEFECT. I APPRECIATE YOUR ASSISTANCE, AND WELCOME THE OPPORTUNITY TO DISCUSS THIS FURTHER WITH YOUR REPRESENTATIVES.

MY ENGINE FAILED, AND HAD TO BE REPLACED, AS A RESULT OF FAULTY HEAD GASKETS.  MY FORD DEALER TOLD ME WHEN I BROUGHT MY CAR IN THAT FORD HAD INSTALLED DEFECTIVE HEAD GASKETS IN CERTAIN MODELS, INCLUDING MINE, IN THE EARLY 1990S, AND THAT THESE GASKETS FAILED, CAUSING ANTIFREEZE TO LEAK INTO THE OIL, WHICH IN TURN DAMAGED THE BEARINGS AND DESTROYED THE ENGINE.  MY FORD DEALER ALSO TOLD ME THAT FORD HAD A PROGRAM TO HELP THOSE WITH 1994 AND 1995 CARS.  I WROTE FORD TO ASK IT TO REIMBURSE ME, BUT FORD WAS RUDE AND ENTIRELY UNHELPFUL. VEHICLE WAS ON THE ENTRANCE RAMP TO A MAJOR HIGHWAY WHEN ENGINE POWER WAS SUDDENLY LOST.  CAR WAS RESTARTED AFTER A TEN MINUTE COOL DOWN.  DROVE FOR ANOTHER 10 MINUTES WHEN ENGINE POWER WAS LOST FOR A SECOND TIME.  CAR WAS UNABLE TO START AFTER THE SECOND FAILURE.  ROOT CAUSE OF THE FAILURE WAS A CORRODED GROUND CONNECT, ITENTIFIED AS C112 (FORD #).  THIS CONNECTOR PROVIDES THE GROUND (NEGATIVE) FOR MAJOR ENGINE AND INSTRUMENTATION COMPONENTS (INSTRUMENT CLUSTER, INTEGRATED CONTROL MODULE, POWER STEERING MODULE, COOLING FAN, ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROL MODULE, OXYGEN SENSORS).  THE LOCATION OF THIS GROUND CONNECTOR NEXT TO THE BATTERY, INCREASES ITS SUSCEPTABILITY TO ACCELERATED CORROSION.  THE GROUND PLUG IS NOT A WATER TIGHT DESIGN.  SEVERE CORROSION OF  THE CONNECTOR BLADES WERE FOUND UPON DISASSEMBLY .  CONNECTOR SHOULD BE REPLACED WITH A TYPE LESS SUSCEPTABLE TO CORROSION.  FAILURES ARE MORE LIKELY WHEN THE CAR IS OPERATING IN HOT DRY WEATHER AND WITH HIGHER ELECTRICAL LOADS.
REPLACED HEAD GASKET AND O2 SENSORS.  THIS IS THE SAME FLAWED ENGINE DESIGN AS THOSE THAT FORD ISSUED AN EXTENDED WARRANTY.  FOR SOME UNKNOWN REASON FORD HAS NOT INCLUDED THE '91 ENGINES.
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOVE VEHICLE. *AK

THE CAR FUEL GAUGE FAILED FIRST SOON AFTER PROBLEMS BEGAN TO OCCUR WITH THE CAR INTERMITTENTLY NOT STARTING. AFTER A FEW DAYS THE CAR WOULD NOT START UPON LEAVING FROM MY WORK. DESCRIPTION OF PROBLEM - GETRAG AWD TRANSFER CASE: THE SUBJECT TRANSFER CASE ON MY 1991 MITSUBISHI 3000GT VR4 IS LEAKING. ACCORDING TO CERTIFIED AUTO REPAIR FACILITIES, THIS LEAKAGE WILL EVENTUALLY CAUSE THE UNIT TO FAIL. IF THE VEHICLE IS IN MOTION AT THE TIME OF FAILURE, INJURY OR DEATH MAY OCCUR AS FAILURE OF THE TRANSFER CASE WHILE THE VEHICLE IS MOVING WILL CAUSE THE WHEELS TO LOCK UP SUDDENLY. AS ARESULT, THE DRIVER MAY LOSE CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE.  I CONTACTED MITSUBISHI CUSTOMER SERVICE REGARDING THIS PROBLEM ON JULY 7, 2000 AND DESCRIBED THE PROBLEM. I ASKED THE REPRESENTATIVE IF THE PROBLEM COULD BE ADDRESSED UNDER MITSUBISHI'S TECHNICAL SERVICE BULLETIN (TSB)# SR93003R; HOWEVER, THE RESPRESENTATIVE REFUSED TO AUTHORIZE THE REPAIR OF MY VEHICLE IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE TSB, IN SPITE OF MY REMINDING HIM OF THE RISK TO MYSELF AND ANY PASSENGERS RIDING IN MY CAR AT THE TIME OF FAILURE. CONSEQUENTLY, I WROTE MITSUBISHI CUSTOMER RELATIONS SUPPORT IN CYPRESS, CA. TO EXPRESS MY CONCERNS.  MISUBISHI HAS NEVER RESPONDED TO MY LETTER AND HAS SIMPLY CHOSEN TO IGNORE MY CONCERNS.

THE SEAT BELT NOT RETRACTING POSES A SERIOUS SAFETY RISK AS IN THE EVENT OF AN ACCIDENT THERE WOULD BE NO SHOULDER RESTRAINT.  THIS IS A VERY COMMON PROBLEM AMOUNT 3000GT'S AND DODGE STEALTHS. ALMOST ALL CARS ARE AFFECTED. I BELIEVE THAT A DEALER RECALL SHOULD BE INSTALLED.  *JB
SEAT BELT FAILS TO RETRACT PROPERLY WHEN SECURED OR UNBUCKLED.  THIS IS THE 3RD MITSUBISHI 3000GT AND STEALTH THAT HAS HAD THIS ISSUE.  *JB
TRANSMISSION FAILED 2 TIMES ON MY 91 MITSUBISHI 3000GT. *JB

1. THE CAR HAD NO SIGN OF FAILURE UNTIL THE AUTOMOBILE WAS IMMOBILE.  2. THE FAILURE WAS THE RESULT OF A DEFECTIVE TRANSFER CASE, AND CAUSED THE CAR'S DRIVE TRAIN TO SEIZE.  3. NO ACTIONS WERE TAKEN TO RESOLVE THE FAILURE.  *NM

I HAVE A 91 MITSUBISHI 3000GT SL. THE SEAT BELTS IN IT HAVE A PROBLEM LOCKING UP AND NOT RELEASING. THE SEAT BELTS IN MY CAR DO NOT FUNCTION PROPERLY SOMETIMES. WHEN THE SEAT BELT IS PULLED ON IT DOES NOT RETRACT, LEAVING ENOUGH SLACK IN THE BELT THAT IF AN ACCIDENT WERE TO OCCUR, IT WOULD NOT SERVE ITS PURPOSE AS A SAFETY RESTRAINT. IN MY OPINION THIS SHOULD BE INCLUDED IN A LIFETIME WARRANTY. SAFETY WAS AN ISSUE WHEN BUILDING CARS OF THESE TYPES SO THEY SHOULD ALWAYS BE AS SAFE AS POSSIBLE. I HAVE HEARD MANY PEOPLE SAY PUT ARMOR ALL ON THE BELTS AND THEY WILL WORK JUST FINE, BUT LIKE MANY OTHER 3000GT OWNERS I HAVE TRIED THIS AND IT DOESN'T WORK. I HAVEN'T OWNED MY CAR LONG BUT THIS WAS ONE OF THE FIRST THINGS I NOTICED ABOUT MY CAR. IT WOULDN'T BOTHER ME THAT MUCH IF I DIDN'T WEAR MY SEAT BELT THAT OFTEN BUT I NEVER GO SOMEWHERE WITHOUT MY SEAT BELT ON. I ALSO HAVEN'T REALLY DROVE ANYBODY AROUND IN MY CAR SO IM NOT REAL SURE ON HOW THE PASSENGER SIDE OR BACK SEAT BELTS WORK. RIGHT NOW IM JUST HAVING PROBLEMS WITH THE DRIVER SIDE SEAT BELT.  *JB

ON MY 1991 DODGE STEALTH R/T TT I HAVE HAD NUMEROUS OCCASIONS OF A SLACK IN BOTH OF MY SEAT BELTS. THE SEAT BELTS DO NOT RETRACT PROPERLY AT ALL. MOST OF THE TIME THE SEAT BELTS JUST HANG LOOSE AND YOU HAVE MANUALLY TRY AND RETRACT THEM (NOT EASY). THIS IS A HUGE PROBLEM WITH SAFETY. IF I WAS TO GET IN A CRASH THE SEAT BELT WOULD NOT BE ABLE TO FUNCTION PROPERLY. THIS IS SCARY FOR MY PASSENGERS AND MYSELF. IT COULD CAUSE DEATH AND NEEDS ATTENTION. THIS IS AN ON GOING PROBLEM. MY SEAT BELTS AND OTHER OWNERS SEAT BELTS OF THE DODGE STEALTH AND MITSUBISHI 3000GT'S ARE HAVING THE SAME SEAT BELT PROBLEM. THIS ISSUE SHOULD BE FIXED UNDER A RECALL.  *NM

I AM ONE OF THE MEMBERS OF 3SI.ORG WHICH IS A WEBSITE COVERING THE 3000GT/STEALTH MODELS FROM 1991-1999. I HAVE NOTICED THAT A LARGELY SHARED MAJORITY OF US HAVE THE SAME PROBLEM. THE PROBLEM IS THAT THE SEAT BELT DOES NOT RETRACT INTO PLACE WHEN PULLED OUT. THE SEAT BELT IS THERFORE EITHER LOOSE ON THE DRIVER AND PASSANGER WHICH CAN LEAD TO DEATH/INJURY OR WHEN THE PERSON IS EXITING THE CAR THE PERSON HAS TO WIND THE BELT BACK INTO THE POSITION SO IT DOESNT FALL OUT OF THE DOOR. THIS IS A SERIOUS SAFETY ISSUE AND I THINK A MUST FOR RECALL. I WAS IN A ACCIDENT RECENTLY AND THE SEAT BELT DID NOT ENGAGE IN TIME AND I HIT MY HEAD ON THE STEERING WHEEL AND HAD TO GO TO THE ER EVEN THOUGH IT WAS A SLIGHT FENDER BENDER. PLEASE ISSUE AN INVESTIGATION ON THIS BELT. BTW MY CAR HAS ONLY 65,000 MILES AND THE SEAT BELT WORE OUT AT 22,000 MILES.

WHILE NOTHING SERIOUS HAS COME OF MY ISSUE YET, THE POTENTIAL IS THERE. MY 91 MITSUBISHI 3000GT (WITH 72,000 MILES) IS HAVING PROBLEMS RETRACTING IT'S SEAT BELT. I NOTICED IT WAS A SAFETY ISSUE WHEN I WAS FORCED TO SUDDENLY STOP (DUE TO A CAT CROSSING THE ROAD) AND THE SEAT BELT DID NOT WANT TO LOCK AND RETRACT IN SATISFACTORY TIME. THERE WAS A SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT OF SLACK LEFT IN THE SEAT BELT THAT COULD POTENTIALLY CAUSE INJURY IN THE EVENT OF AN ACCIDENT.  WHEN I TALKED WITH MY LOCAL MITSUBISHI DEALERSHIP ABOUT IT THEY TOLD ME THEY WOULD HAVE TO CHANGE OUT THE MECHANISM THAT RETRACTS THE BELT, BUT THAT IT WAS NOT COVERED UNDER WARRANTY. AS A SAFETY ISSUE I BELIEVE IT SHOULD BE A A RECALL AS I HAVE TALKED WITH MANY OTHER 3000GT OWNERS WHO HAVE THE SAME PROBLEM.  *JB

TL* - THE CONTACT PURCHASED A 1991 MITSUBISHI 3000GT VR4 DECEMBER 9, 2006.  THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING AT 75 MPH UNDER DRY ROAD CONDITIONS AND LIGHT TRAFFIC, THE VEHICLE SHOOK AND VIBRATED A FEW TIMES.  THE CONTACT SLOWED DOWN TO STOP THE VEHICLE, WHILE REDUCING SPEED TO 10 MPH THE VEHICLE REAR WHEELS LOCKED CAUSING THE VEHICLE TO SKID ABOUT 20 FEET.  NO ONE WAS STRUCK OR INJURED DURING THIS INCIDENT.  THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN BY FLAT BED TRUCK TO A LOCAL SHOP WHERE THE DRIVE SHAFT WAS REMOVED ALLOWING THE WHEELS TO MOVE.  THERE WAS A TRACE OF LIQUID ON THE TRANSFER CASE THAT HAD A BURNT SMELL.  THE CONTACT FOUND OUT ABOUT THE RECALL WHILE RESEARCHING WWW.3SI.ORG.  THERE IS A RECALL ON THE TRANSFER CASE AND RELATES TO OIL LEAKING OUT THAT MAY CAUSE THE REAR WHEELS TO LOCK.  THE CONTACT CALLED MITSUBISHI IN REGARDS TO THE RECALL.  MITSUBISHI INFORMED THE CONTACT OF A RECALL ISSUED IN JAN 2003. THE  REPAIRS FOR HIS CAR WERE MADE JULY 8TH 2003.  MITSUBISHI EXPLAINED THAT THEY COULD NOT PAY FOR THESE REPAIRS SINCE THE VEHICLE WAS ALREADY SEEN FOR THE RECALL.    THE CONSUMER STATED PAID OVER $2,000 FOR REPAIRS. UPDATED 08/13/07  *TR

SEAT BELTS IN 1991 MITSUBISHI 3000GT VR4 DO NOT RETRACT!!!  WIDESPREAD ISSUE AMONG 3000GT AND GTO OWNERS!  PLEASE OPEN INVESTIGATION AS THIS IS HIGHLY DANGEROUS SINCE SEAT BELTS DO NOTHING IF THEY FAIL TO CINCH-UP AS DESIGNED.  *NM

I HAVE PREVIOUSLY ENTERED A COMPLAINT CONCERNING THIS, BUT NO EVIDENCE HAS BEEN SEEN PROVING EFFORT BEING MADE TOWARD THIS ISSUE.  SEAT BELTS WILL NOT PROPERLY RETRACT!  MANY 3000GT AND STEALTH OWNERS HAVE THIS PROBLEM.  THIS MUST BE ADDRESSED IMMEDIATELY!  WHEN THE BELT IS BUCKLED USUALLY ONLY THE LOWER HALF IS TIGHT ENOUGH TO RESTRAIN PASSENGER AND DRIVER.  FOR THE AVERAGE HEIGHT DRIVER THIS MEANS A SUDDEN STOP (OR CRASH OF COURSE) WILL RESULT IN HIS OR HER HEAD SLAMMING INTO THE TOP OF THE STEERING WHEEL OR DASHBOARD FOR PASSENGER (YUM, BRAINS ALL OVER MY CAR, CANT WAIT).  MANY 3000GT AND STEALTH OWNERS HAVE FILED THIS COMPLAINT NATIONWIDE AND WE WILL BE HEARD!  THIS IS NOT OF COURSE A THREAT, BUT AN AFFIRMATION THAT WE WILL BE STAYING ON TOP OF THIS UNTIL IT IS PROPERLY HANDLED.  MOST OF OUR BELTS OR NOT WORN, AND LOTS OF US HAVE FOUND (THOSE WHO HAVE CHECKED) THAT OUR BELT SPOOLS ARE IN FACT PROPERLY LUBRICATED BUT YET, STILL WE WOULD BE BETTER OF USING TWINE TO TIE OURSELVES TO THE SEATS.  PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE TAKE THIS INTO CONSIDERATION BECAUSE IF OUR BELTS DON'T WORK, THERE REALLY ISN'T ANY REASON FOR US TO EVEN HAVE THEM.  CANT SAY FOR SURE HOW MANY FAILURES, JUST THINK THIS...EVERY TIME.  THANK YOU   *JB
SEAT BELT DOES NOT FULLY RETRACT, LEAVING SLACK ON THE BELT. THE SLACK HAS TO BE MANUALLY REMOVED. THIS CAN CAUSE SERIOUS INJURY IN A CRASH.  *JB

I BOUGHT A 1991 MITSUBISHI GALANT LS 4DR FROM A LOCAL DEALER(YORKTOWN MITSUBISHI, NEW YORK) 4 MONTHS AGO. A FEW DAYS AGO WHILE DRIVING MY CAR, THE ECU UNIT (ELECTRONIC CONTROL MODULE) BURNED OUT AND ALL OF THE POWER IN THE CAR SUBSEQUENTLY SHUT OFF. KEEP IN MIND THAT THE FUSE DID NOT BLOW WHEN THIS HAPPENED WHICH INDICATES THAT IT WAS THE PART ITSELF WHICH MALFUNCTIONED AND NOT SOME OTHER ELECTRICAL SOURCE. IT WAS A GOOD THING THAT I WAS NOT DRIVING ON THE HIGHWAY, OTHERWISE I WOULD HAVE BEEN IN REAL TROUBLE. ANYWAY, AFTER TAKING WITH SEVERAL DEALERS, I WAS TOLD THAT THE "ECUS" "HAVE BEEN KNOWN TO GO (BURN OUT)". THE DEMAND FOR THIS PART IS VERY AS WELL AS THE PRICE $800 WHILE THE SUPPLY IS VERY LOW. A COUPLE OF DEALERS TOLD ME THAT SEVERAL CUSTOMERS HAVE EXPERIENCED THIS PROBLEM, REPLACED THE UNIT WITH A NEW ONE AND IT BURN OUT AGAIN, SOME OF THEM TWICE MORE. SINCE THIS PROBLEM HAS OCURRED TO SEVERAL OTHERS AND PRESENTS SERIOUS SAFETY CONCERN, I DEEM IT NECESSARILY WORTHY OF AN INVESTIGATION OF SOME SORT , PERHAPS LEADING TO A RECALL.  *AK

The contact owns a 1991 Mitsubishi Mighty Max. The contact stated while the vehicle was parked, the driver's side front seat belt was latched; however, the front driver's seat belt buckle failed to latch as intended. The contact received notification of NHTSA Campaign Number: 95V103004 (Seat Belts). The vehicle was taken to the dealer for the recall repair; however, the contact was informed that the recall repair was completed.  The failure reoccurred.  The dealer was made aware of the failure. The contact was informed that the front driver's side seat belt buckle was not included in the recall repair. The manufacturer was not made aware of the failure. The failure mileage was 185,000.

THIS  AN INTERMITTENT PROBLEM. THE ENGINE WILL START TO SHUDDER AND LOSE POWER AS IF IT IS STARVING FOR AIR OR GAS.  CONTINUE   DRIVING WILL MAKE THE PROBLEM WORSE UNTIL THE VEHICLE STALLS COMPLETELY. FURTHER ATTEMPTS ON RESTARTING WILL RESULT IN THE   ENGINE SHUDDERING, RUNNING FOR A MINUTE OR SO AND THEN SHUTTING DOWN. IF THE VEHICLE IS LEFT FOR A WHILE (A FEW HOURS).,  IT WILL START UP PERFECTLY AND  RUN FOR A WHILE (FROM A FEW MILES TO HUNDREDS OF MILES) UNTIL THE PROBLEM OCCURS AGAIN. THE   VEHICLE HAS BEEN TO THE DEALER OVER 9 TIMES (COSTING >$2000), AND NUMEROUS REPLACEMENT OF PARTS TO NO AVAIL.
NO SUMMARY PROVIDER BY CONSUMER.

WHILE DRIVING AT APPROXIMATELY 25 MPH NOT FAR FROM HOME, THE BACK REST PORTION OF THE SEAT COLLAPSED INTO THE BACK SEAT AREA.  I WAS ABLE TO MAINTAIN CONTROL OF THE CAR ALTHOUGH I ALMOST WENT OFF THE ROAD DUE TO THE SUDDENESS AND SURPRISE OF IT HAPPENING.  AFTER DRIVING THE CAR BACK HOME (WITH GREAT DIFFICULTY) AND INVESTIGATING THE SEATBACK SUPPORT STRUCTURE, I FOUND THE METAL FRAME WAS SHEARED IN TWO AT THE LOWER LEFT PORTION OF THE SEATBACK.  THE NEXT DAY I USED A BOARD TO PROP THE SEAT UP TEMPORARILY, AND DROVE IT TO THE DEALER FROM WHOM I PURCHASED THE CAR NEW IN 1991.  THEY CONFIRMED THAT THE SEAT BACK METAL FRAME HAD BROKEN IN TWO PIECES DUE TO "METAL FATIGUE"  BUT IT WAS NOT COVERED UNDER THE MANUFACTURER'S WARRANTY DUE TO TIME AND MILEAGE.  I NOTIFIED NISSAN ON THEIR TOLL-FREE NUMBER; THEY ENTERED IN ALL MY INFORMATION, AND ALSO CONFIRMED THAT IT WAS NOT A COVERED ITEM.  THIS, IN MY OPINION, IS A SERIOUS SAFETY RELATED DEFECT WHICH HAS APPEARED ON AT LEAST 6 OTHER CARS FROM THIS YEAR'S MODEL, ACCORDING TO NHTSA RECORDS. (ODI ID 978630, 972906, 909103, 811801, 824075 AND 517783.  I ALSO FOUND EXAMPLES ON TWO 1992  AND THREE 1990 MAXIMA MODELS.  NISSAN HAS HAD THIS PROBLEM FOR MANY MODEL YEARS, AND NO ONE KNOWS HOW MANY MAY HAVE OCCURRED THAT HAVE NOT BEEN REPORTED TO NHTSA.  SOME PEOPLE SUFFERED INJURIES DUE TO THIS SEAT FAILURE, AND THAT MAKES IT A SERIOUS SAFETY DEFECT THAT SHOULD REQUIRE MORE INVESTIGATION SINCE THE MANUFACTURER THINKS THIS IS WITHIN "ACCEPTABLE LIMITS' CONSIDERING THE NUMBER OF THESE CARS SOLD.  IT MAY BE ACCEPTABLE TO THEM, BUT NOT WHEN IT'S MY OR MY FAMILY'S LIFE IN JEOPARDY.  PLEASE LET ME KNOW IF ANYTHING FURTHER CAN BE DONE.  I'M HAVING THE SEAT REBUILT BY THE DEALER AT MY OWN EXPENSE.

UNKNOWN TO ME AS EXPLAINED TO ME BY TRANSMISSION MECHANIC THE TORQUE CONVERTER WAS DISINTEGRATING OVER TIME PUTTING DEBRIS INTO TRANSMISSION COOLER LOCATED INSIDE THE RADIATOR. THIS CLOGGED UP THE RADIATOR THUS PREVENTING COOLING OF TRANSMISSION. TRANSMISSION GEARS THUS WORE OUT DUE TO EXCESSIVE HEAT. THE MECHANIC WHOSE SPECIALTY IS TRANSMISSIONS HAS RECEIVED BULLETINS FROM HIS TRADE ASSOCIATION AND NISSAN ON THIS MATTER BUT AT THE TIME COULD ONLY SHOW ME BULLETIN FROM THE "INFINITY Q45 "MODEL WHO HAS THE SAME TRANSMISSION AND PROBLEMS. MECHANIC TOLD ME THAT NISSAN ADVICE WAS TO ADD AN EXTERNAL TRANSMISSION COOLER WHICH WOULD ALLOW A LITTLE LONGER LIFE, BUT EVENTUALLY THE TORQUE CONVERTER WILL GO. I HAD ONLY 62K MILES AND CONSIDER THIS NOT ENOUGH TO WARRANT TRANSMISSION FAILURE.  NISSAN DOES NOT HAVE A RECALL ON THIS THUS WILL NOT HELP OUT ON EXPENSES. THINGS GOT PROGRESSIVELY WORSE AS I BEGAN TO SMELL GAS WHILE DRIVING THE CAR. FUMES APPARENTLY BEGAN LEAKING INTO THE CAR INTERIOR. FUEL INJECTORS SHOULD NOT LEAK IF DESIGNED PROPERLY. FUEL INJECTORS ARE LEAKING GAS FROM THE INJECTOR SEALS.  MY BROTHER OWNS A GEO PRIZM WITH A TOYOTA MOTOR IN IT WITH ALMOST 300,000 MILES ON IT AND HAS NEVER HAD THIS PROBLEM EVER.  MY NISSAN STANZA ONLY HAS 133,000 ON IT AND I HAVE SEEN COMPLAINTS ON WEB FORUMS ABOUT 240SX WITH SAME KA24E SOHC MOTOR HAVING THE SAME PROBLEMS WITH LESS MILEAGE ON THEM. THEY SWITCHED TO THE KA24DE DOHC ENGINE IN LATER YEAR STANZA'S.  I THINK THEY ALSO DID SO ON THE 240SX TOO, BUT NOT SURE WHICH YEARS THIS HAPPENED. I KNOW THE STANZA USED KA24E MOTOR FROM 1990 TO 1992 PRODUCTION YEARS AND THEN SWITCHED TO THE KA24DE AFTER WHICH COULD POSSIBLY HAVE DIFFERENT INJECTOR SETUP THEN THE KA24E WHICH IS WHAT I HAVE.  *JB

I HAVE A 1991 OLDSMOBILE CUSTOM CRUISER (STATION WAGON).  FOR THE LAST TWO DAYS, VEHICLE HAS BEEN "SWIGGLY" WHEN COMING TO A STOP. NOT SO BAD YESTERDAY, NOTICEABLY WORSE TODAY.   A STUCK FRONT CALIPER WAS SUSPECTED.  HOWEVER, ON THE WAY HOME FROM WORK TODAY VEHICLE BECAME VERY UNSTABLE WHILE DECELERATING FROM APPROX.  50 MPH.  VEHICLE WAS IMMEDIATELY PULLED TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD AND INSPECTED FOR A FLAT TIRE, ETC.  NO OBVIOUS  PROBLEM WAS FOUND.  UPON ATTEMPTING TO RE-ENTER TRAFFIC, THE DRIVER SIDE REAR LOWER CONTROL ARM BRACKET WAS RIPPED FROM THE REAR AXLE HOUSING CAUSING THE TIRE TO HIT THE FRONT OF THE WHEEL WELL CAUSING BODY DAMAGE.  WHEN FOOT WAS REMOVED FROM THE ACCELERATOR, THE TIRE THEN SLAMMED INTO THE BACK OF THE WHEEL WELL CAUSING MORE BODY DAMAGE, AND BRINGING THE CAR TO A SCREECHING HALT, LUCKILY STILL ON THE SIDE OF THE ROAD.  THE DRIVE SHAFT WAS ALSO PULLED FROM THE TRANSMISSION AND IS NOW WEDGED TIGHT.  VEHICLE HAD TO BE TOWED HOME.  INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE BRACKET THAT RIPPED LOOSE HAD BEEN ATTACHED TO THE AXLE TUBE WITH TWO SHORT WELDS, AS IS DONE DURING FIXTURING, AND NEVER FULLY WELDED.  THE OTHER SIDE BRACKET IS FULLY WELDED.  IF THIS WOULD HAD HAPPENED AT SPEED, THE CONSEQUENCES PROBABLY WOULD HAVE BEEN DEADLY AS THE CAR WOULD HAVE GONE INTO AN UNCONTROLLED SKID INTO OPPOSING TRAFFIC.  *NM

ANYTIME THE BATTERY IS DISCONNECTED, IT WIPES OUT THE COMPUTER MEMORY, CAUSING STALLING, ERADIC SHIFTING, ENGINE FAILURE, AND LOSS OF CONTROL.  THIS IS NOT NOTICED UNTIL CAR IS DRIVEN, AND DIDN'T APPEAR UNTILL TRAVELING AT 45 MPH.  DEALER SAID THIS IS PART OF HE VEHICLE DESIGN AND IT WILL COST $60.00 TO REPROGRAM THE COMPUTER ANY TIME THAT THE BATTERY IS DISCONNECTED OR FAILS.  THIS PROBLEM CAN BE POTENTIALLY DANGEROUS IF THE CAR FAILS AT A HIGH RATE OF SPEED CAUSING VERY STIFF STEERING AND BRAKING.

I PURCHASED A 91 OLDSMOBILE CUTLASS SUPREME AS A "DEMO" MODEL FROM A LOCAL DEALER. I WAS THE FIRST "TITLED" OWNER OF THE CAR. FROM THE TIME I PURCHASED THE CAR IN 92, I NOTICED "SPLITTING OR CRACKLING" IN THE PAINT OF THE CAR. AFTER A FEW YEARS, IT BEGAN FLAKING AT THE CRACKED AREAS AND PEELING. I MENTIONED THIS TO THE DEALER WHERE I PURCHASED THE CAR AND TOOK IT FOR REGULARLY SCHEDULED MAINTENANCE. THEY INFORMED THAT THERE WAS NOTHING THEY COULD DO SINCE THERE WAS NO RECALL ON THE DEFECT. DRIVING DOWN THE ROAD CAME TO A STOP SIGN, MADE A RIGHT HAND TURN TRIED TO STRAIGHTEN  THE WHEELS OUT.  THE STEERING WHEEL JUST KEPT SPINNING AROUND AND AROUND.  WAS ABLE TO MANUEVER THE VEHICLE TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD.     FAILURE WAS:  THE REAR CRADLE BOLTS THROUGH THE RETAINERS DUE TO CORROSION OF THE RETAINER AND THE REAR CRADLE DROPPED DOWN AND CAUSED THE STEERING SHAFT TO DISCONNECT FROM THE STEERING GEAR.  THEREFOR THE CAR WOULD NO LONGER STEER.      WE AVE A FOUR YEAR OLD AND A SIX YEAR AND HAD WE BEEN GOING 50 MPH THIS COULD HAD BEEN A SERIOUS CATASTROPHE.  I CALLED GM AND INFORMED THEM OF THIS PROBLEM AND ASKED IF THERE WERE ANY RECALLS ON THIS, THEY SAID NO BUT TOOK THE INFORMATION AND WOULD KEEP IT ON RECORD IN CASE THERE ARE MORE OCCURANCES OF THIS SITUATION.    I THEN WENT TO THE COMPUTER AND CHECKED THE NHTSA RECALL INFORMATION, AND FOUND THAT THERE THERE WAS ONE ON THE 1990 PONTIAC GRAND PRIX AND MINIVANS.  WE HAVE THE OLDESMOBILE EQUIVALENT OF THE PONTIAC TRANSPORT.  THE RECALL DATE WAS 4/8/1997, THE VEHICLE COMPONENT AFFECTED IS THE STRUCTURE AND THE NHTSA RECALL NUMBER IS 97V058000.    I THEN CALLED GM BACK WITH THIS INFORMATION, BECAUSE THE PONTIAC TRANSPORT THAT WAS RECALLED IS THE SAME VEHICLE AS THE OLDESMOBILE SILHOUETTE THAT I AM DRIVING.  THEY SAID THAT BECAUSE ITS AN OLDS AND NOT A PONTIAC IT WOULD NOT BE COVERED UNDER THE RECALL, EVEN THOUGH THEY ARE IDENTICAL VEHICLES.    ONE ADDITIONAL CONCERN, IS THAT THERE MAY BE MANY OTHER SIMNILAR OLDSMOBILE SILHOUETTE AND CHEVROLET LUMINA VANS THAT COULD EXPERIENCE THESE SAME MALFUNCTIONS.  IF THIS SHOLD HAPPEN TO SOMEONE AT HIGHER SPEEDS AND WITH THE TOTAL LOSS OF STEERING WHEN THIS STRUCTURE BREAKS LOOSE COULD BE DISASTEROUS FOR THE PERSON DRIVING THE VEHICLE AND ITS PASSENGERS AS WELL AS ANY ONCOMING VEHICLES.    I WOULD LIKE THIS INVESTIGATED AND FEEL STRONGLY THAT THESE OTHER GM MODELS SHOULD ALSO BE RECALLED.

TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERN ON THE DATE OF MARCH 9TH 1998 I WAS DOWN THE RT 2  ROAD IN LATHAM, NY THEN ALL OF A SUDDEN THE TRANSMISSION DROPPED IN LOW GEAR AND AT 45 MILES AND IT SLOWED DOWN TO AROUND 30 WINDINGS SOUND COMING FROM THE  GEARS AND I KNEW IT WAS THE TRANSMISSION THEN I TOOK IT TO GOLDSTEIN'S WHERE I BOUGHT IT AND THEY TOOK A LOOK AT IT AND TOLD ME IT WAS THE TRANSMISSION AND TOLD ME A UNBELIEVABLE PRICE TO FIX SO THEN I TOOK TO COTTMANS AT 912 NEW LOUDON ROAD IN LATHAM ,NY.I WAS QUOTED A PRICE AT $1,350.00 SO I HAD THEM FIX IT, THE MILEAGE WAS AT  88,490 NOW AFTER ABOUT  3 DAYS LATER I DROVE THIS VAN FOR 24,000 MILES MORE WHICH THE MILEAGE  WAS AT 113,000 MILES AND  THE TRANSMISSION WENT AGAIN.  I AM MARRIED WITH 3 CHILDREN AND DID NOT CAUSE THIS BY NEGLECT , THIS CAR WAS SERVICED ON TIME ON EVERYTHING AND TAKEN CARE OF . I FEEL THAT IN THE FIRST PLACE THIS TRANSMISSION SHOULD OF BEEN A RECALL IN THE FIRST  PLACE.  THE TRANSMISSION THAT WAS PUT INTO THESE VANS WERE NOT MADE TO HANDLE THE VEHICLE.  THANK YOU .

ON 2/25/01, MY 16 YR. OLD DAUGHTER WAS TRAVELING ON A DIRT ROAD AT A SPEED OF APPROX. 25MPH AND HIT AN ICEY SPOT. SHE LOST CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE. THE DRIVERS SIDE DOOR AND DRIVERS SIDE FRONT SUSTAINED DAMAGE AS DID THE PASSENGER SIDE FRONT AND SIDE. SHE WAS SEATBELTED IN9 THERE WERE BRUISES ON HER CHEST AND NECK FROM THE SEATBELT. THE AIRBAG DID NOT DEPLOY AND THE SEATBELT SOMEHOW RELEASED AND SHE WAS FOUND ON THE SIDE OF THE ROAD. SHE FRACURED 7 VERTEBRAE IN HER BACK, LEFT FACIAL BONE FRACTURES, SMALL FRACURE TO THE RIGHT FACE,& BILATERAL PNEMOTHORACES. AND A CLOSED HEAD INJURY. SHE HAD TO HAVE SURGERY ON HER BACK TO CORRECT THE INJURIES, AND WILL NOT BE ABLE TO RETURN TO SCHOOL FOR AT LEAST 6 WEEKS. I AM QUESTIONING WHY THE AIRBAG DID NOT DEPLOY AND WHY THE SEAT BELT WAS RELEASED.       *AK

WE ARE THE SECOND OWNERS OF THIS VEHICLE. BASED ON ALL SERVICE RECORDS THE TRANSMISSION IN THIS VEHICLE HAS BEEN REPAIRED  TWICE, AND IS NOW BROKEN AGAIN. EACH TIME THERE IS A PROBLEM IT SEEMS TO BE ALMOST EXACTLY TWO YEARS LATER. IN THE 2ND INSTANCE IT WAS 1 YR AND 3 MONTHS AFTER REPAIR THAT THE TRANSMISSION REQUIRED MAJOR WORK AGAIN. IT APPEARS FROM THE TESTIMONY OF MANY OTHER OWNERS OF THE SAME VEHICLE THAT THIS PROBLEM IS WIDESPREAD AND SHOULD BE CONSIDERED A FLAW IN THE DESIGN OF THE TRANSMISSION. WE ARE OVERALL QUITE HAPPY WITH THIS VEHICLE HOWEVER THIS TYPE OR RE-OCCURING PROBLEM IS ABSOLUTELY UNACCEPTABLE, ESPECIALLY CONSIDERING THE TIME FRAME. WE INTEND TO SEEK ASSISTANCE AND/OR COMPENSATION WITH REGARDS TO THIS RE-OCCURING PROBLEM. ANY ADDITIONAL INFORMATION ON THIS SUBJECT WOULD BE GREATLY APPRECIATED.*AK

NHTSA ISSUED A RECALL FOR GRAND VOYAGER MINIVANS MANUFACTURED BETWEEN 07/1990 AND 06/1993 TO HAVE THE BRAKE ACTUATOR PISTON ASSEMBLY AND THE PUMP-MOTOR ASSEMBLY TO BE REPLACED FOR LIFETIME COVERAGE.  NHTSA ISSUED THE RECALL ON 06/18/1996. THE NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER IS 96V099000. I CONTACTED CHRYSLER ON 4/23/2002 TO DISCUSS THE RECALL. CHRYSLER CLAIMS THAT THAT RECALL AFFECTED GRAND VOYAGER VANS PRODUCED BEFORE MINE WAS PRODUCED AND AFTER MINE WAS PRODUCED. I FIND THIS EXCUSE ABSURD. MY VEHICLE CLEARLY HAS THE SAME DEFECTIVE PARTS. MY PUMP-MOTOR CONTINUALLY RUNS AND HAS AN AIR LEAK SO BAD YOU CAN HEAR IT. I DID NOT LEARN ABOUT THE RECALL UNTIL YESTERDAY WHEN SOME FRIENDS OF MINE INFORMED ME THAT CHRYSLER REPLACED THEIR PUMPS AT NO COST FOR HAVING THE SAME PROBLEMS AS MINE. THE FAILURE OCCURRED AT ANY SPEED AND IN ANY TYPE OF WEATHER.*AK

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1991 PLYMOUTH GRAND VOYAGER.  WHILE DRIVING BETWEEN 10-40 MPH UNDER NORMAL CONDITIONS, THE ANTILOCK BRAKES LOCKED UP.  THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED DUE TO NHTSA RECALL NUMBER 96V099000 (SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:ANTILOCK), HOWEVER, THE FAILURE STILL PERSISTS.  THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 136,000 AND FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 90,000.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1991 PLYMOUTH GRAND VOYAGER.  THE CONTACT TOOK THE VEHICLE TO THE DEALER FOR A BRAKING SYSTEM DIAGNOSTIC.  HE STATED THAT BOTH BRAKE LIGHTS WOULD ILLUMINATE, BUT THE BRAKE ASSIST WOULD NOT ENGAGE.  THE DIAGNOSTIC INDICATED THAT A HYDRAULIC ASSEMBLY, PUMP MOTOR, AND ACCUMULATOR WERE NEEDED.  THESE PARTS ARE ON A MANUFACTURER SAFETY RECALL (NUMBER 685) FOR THE LIFETIME OF THE VEHICLE.  THE MANUFACTURER STATED THAT THE PARTS WERE NO LONGER UNDER WARRANTY.  THE CONTACT STATED THAT HE HAS A RECALL NOTICE FOR NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 96V099000 (SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC:ANTILOCK) THAT STATES THE PARTS ARE STILL UNDER A LIFETIME WARRANTY AT NO COST.  CHRYSLER STATED THAT THE PARTS WERE IN STOCK AND THEY WOULD REPLACE THE PARTS AFTER HE PROVIDED THE DOCUMENTATION.  THE CONTACT WAS ISSUED REFERENCE NUMBER 16944985.  THE BRAKES WOULD GRADUALLY STOP THE VEHICLE FROM A DISTANCE WHEN APPROACHING A LIGHT.  IN ORDER FOR THE VEHICLE TO COME TO A COMPLETE STOP, HE MUST DEPRESS THE BRAKE PEDAL WITH BOTH FEET.  THE SPEED WAS UNKNOWN.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 221,000 AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 222,000.

WE OWN A 1991 PLYMOUTH GRAND VOYAGER.  ON JANUARY 9, 2006 THE ABS WARNING LIGHT ILLUMINATED.  WE HAD THE BRAKES OF OUR PLYMOUTH GRAND VOYAGER SUPPOSEDLY FIXED BY CROWN CHRYSLER IN GREENSBORO, NC AT THIS TIME.  WE BOUGHT THE CAR TO THE DEALERSHIP BASED ON NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER 96V099000 (SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC; ANTILOCK).       IN OCTOBER OF 2007, THE ABS BRAKES QUIT WORKING AGAIN.  THE ABS WARNING LIGHT ILLUMINATED.  AFTER TALKING TO OUR MECHANIC, WE FINALLY BOUGHT THE CAR BACK TO THE DEALERSHIP IN GREENSBORO ON JANUARY 25, 2008.  THE DEALER STATED THAT THE ABS CAB CONTROLLER NEEDED TO BE REPLACED.  HOWEVER, THE PART WAS NO LONGER BEING MANUFACTURED.  HE ADVISED US TO CHECK WITH A SALVAGE YARD FOR PARTS.  AFTER TAKING THE  CAR TO THE DEALER TO CHECK THE ABS AND BRAKE LIGHT , MY HUSBAND LOOKED UNDER THE HOOD AND FOUND BRAKE FLUID SPILLED OVER THE ENTIRE MASTER CYLINDER.  THE BRAKE FLUID LEVEL WAS EMPTY AFTER THE DEALER CHECKED THE CAR OUT AND RETURNED IT TO US.  SINCE THIS RECALL HAD A LIFETIME WARRANTY ON IT, IT SHOULD BE THE DEALERS RESPONSIBILITY TO FIX THE ABS BRAKE SYSTEM WITHOUT CHARGE.          THE PART WAS PREVIOUSLY REPLACED AT 50,847 MILES UNDER NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER 96V099000 (SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC : ANTILOCK)  THE POWER TRAIN IS AUTOMATIC.  THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 50,847 AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 58,791.         PLEASE HELP US TO RESOLVE THIS PROBLEM WITH THE DEALERSHIP.  *TR

THE NEW ENGINE HEAD CAME WITH A SPECIAL STUD IN THE SAME AREA WHERE THE OLD PART HAD BEEN BROKEN.  MY INVOICE FROM THE REPAIR SHOP INDICATES THESE REPAIRS IN MORE DETAIL.  I ALSO STILL HAVE THE ORIGINAL PARTS.  I CONTACTED CHRYSTLER FOR REIMBURSEMENT FOR THESE REPAIRS AND WAS TOLD THAT DUE TO THE AGE AND MILAGE OF MY VEHICLE THEY WERE DENYING MY CLAIM.   WHEN I ASKED THEM ABOUT THE UNUSUAL NUMBER OF BOTH OF THESE PARTS BEING ON BACK ORDER, IT DIDN'T SEEM TO BE A CONCERN TO THEM NOR DID THE LOOK INTO THE POSSIBILITY OF THESE ITEMS NEEDING TO BE RECALLS.

I GOT A STRONG ODOR OF GAS IN THE CAB, TOOK IT TO MY MECHANIC WHO DETERMINED THE FUEL INJECTOR SEALS AND RAIL WERE LEAKING. THEY ARE TELLING ME THEY WILL SHIP SOME OUT ON 1/21, BUT DO NOT HAVE ENOUGH TO MEET ALL THE ORDERS!!!!!  WHAT'S GOING ON?  ALSO, A FEW MONTHS AGO, I WAS GOING ALONG DOWN THE ROAD AND THE VAN JUST "LOCKED UP" AND STOPPED. --LUCKILY I WAS TRAVELING FAIRLY SLOWL WHEN I RAN OFF THE ROAD AND THERE WERE NO INJURIES.  BUT THERE WERE NO WARNING SIGNS, NO NOISES, NOTHING.  THE TRANSMISSION JUST WENT OUT AND LOCKED UP THE VEHICLE.  ANY IDEAS WHAT'S GOING ON WITH THESE TWO THINGS?  I'M VERY INTERESTED IN LEARNING WHY THE ENTIRE COUNTRY IS WAITING ON THIS ONE PART.  *AK

I AM SORRY THAT I DO NOT HAVE ALL OF THE INFORMATION NECESSARY.  I NEVER KNEW HOW TO FILL OUT A COMPLAINT LIKE THIS BEFORE.  A FEW YEARS AGO, MY CAR WOULD NOT START AND WHEN IT DID IT STALLED OUT.  IT HAD AROUND 80,000 MILES ON IT AT THE TIME.  I TOOK IT IN TO BE SERVICED FREQUENTLY.  THEN IT BEGAN TO SMOKE WHEN IT WAS DRIVEN.  FINALLY, I SPOKE TO A DEALER CONCERNING THESE PROBLEMS AND HE SAID THAT I NEEDED TO BRING IT IN FOR AN OVERHAUL. I EXPLAINED THAT I WAS JUST CALLING FOR A PRICE, APPT FOR A TUNEUP AND HE SAID THAT IF I HAD THE PLYMOUTH VOYAGER AND I WAS LUCKY ENOUGH TO HAVE GOTTEN THAT FAR AND IT WAS STILL WORKING THEN IT NEEDED A MAJOR OVERHAUL.  THEY ALL DID HE SAID.  THAT'S WHEN I STARTED NOTICING THE OTHER MINIVANS ON THE ROAD.  THE SLIGHTLY OLDER ONES.  ALL OF THEM HAVE WHITISH GRAY SMOKE COMING FROM THE TAIL PIPE.  ALL OF THEM EXCEPT FOR THE ONES THAT HAVE ALREADY HAD TO REPLACE THEIR ENGINES AND/OR HAD MAJOR OVERHAULS INVOLVING THE REPLACEMENT OF THE VALVES.  NOW MY CAR IS LEAKING OIL AND THE MECHANIC WON'T WORK ON IT ANYMORE EVEN A MINOR TUNEUP BECAUSE HE SAYS THAT THE ENGINE IS GOING TO BLOW UP.  I CAN'T AFFORD TO REPLACE IT.  I CAN'T AFFORD TO REPAIR IT.  I'VE BEEN DRIVING IT THE WAY IT IS BECAUSE I HAVE NO CHOICE.  I HAVE MADE IT A POINT TO SPEAK TO OTHER VAN OWNERS THAT I HAVE SEEN ON THE ROAD.  THEY ALL HAVE THE SAME PROBLEM.  NO MATTER HOW WELL OR HOW BADLY YOU MAINTAIN THE VEHICLE YOU HAVE THE SAME RESULT.  I RECENTLY HEARD THAT MITSUBISHI HAS BEEN INVESTIGATED FOR SELLING DEFECTIVE AUTOMOBILES.  THE PLYMOUTH VOYAGER HAS A MITSUBISHI ENGINE IN IT.  I BELIEVE THE DODGE CARAVAN HAS THE SAME ENGINE AND THE SAME PROBLEM.  I DON'T KNOW HOW THIS SYSTEM WORKS OR HOW LONG IT TAKES.  BUT I DO KNOW THAT THESE ENGINES ARE PUTTING OUT INCREDIBLE AMOUNTS OF EXHAUST WHICH MUST VIOLATE SOME SORT OF REGULATION. THANK YOU FOR READING THIS.  IF I CAN ANSWER ANY FURTHER QUESTIONS, PLEASE LET ME KNOW. I'D APPRECIATE ANY HELP YOU CAN GIVE ME.  *AK

LIGHT FROM HEADLIGHTS HAS GRADUALLY DIMMED OVER THE YEARS ALTHOUGH BULBS HAVE BEEN REPLACED.  CAUSE APPEARS TO BE LACK OF AGING-  AND/OR UV-RESISTANCE ON THE PART OF THE HEADLAMP LENSE (SEPARATE BULB/LENSE DESIGN), WHICH I BELIEVE IS MADE OF POLYCARBONATE (POSSIBLY ACRYLIC OR OTHER MATERIAL), WHICH HAS SUBSTANTIALLY YELLOWED WITH AGING AND/OR EXPOSURE TO SUNLIGHT.  WHEN NEW, THE LENSES WERE COMPLETELY CLEAR, BUT ARE NOW QUITE YELLOWED. THIS IS A SERIOUS SAFETY HAZARD, AND I BELIEVE THE MANUFACTURER SHOULD REPLACE THESE DEFECTIVE SAFETY-RELATED PARTS.  I BELIEVE THE LIGHT OUTPUT IS LIKELY BELOW FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS AT THIS TIME.  *AK

VEHICLE IN QUESTION HAS ALWAYS BEEN EXPERTLY MAINTAINED. THE PROBLEM HERE, IS THE RE PLACEMENT OF CALIPERS DURING A REBUILD SEQUENCE ALLOWS FOR THE REBUILDER, THE RIGHT TO REPLACE A METAL CYLINDER WITH A "PHENOLIC" LIKE CYLINDER, WHICH HAS FAILED TWICE WITHIN A 5 MONTH PERIOD ON BOTH FRONT WHEELS. WHILE ON OCCASION A CALIPER OR WHEEL CYLINDER MAY GO BAD-THIS DESIGN IS SERIOUSLY FLAWED IN IT'S ENGINEERING CONCEPT. THE PHENOLIC PISTONS DO NOT DISSIPATE HEAT PROPERLY, AND BECAUSE OF THE DESIGN FLAW OF WHERE THE CYLINDER PROTRACTS WHEN IT MEETS THE STEEL BACKING OF THE BRAKE PAD LEAVES FULLY 1/3 OF THE PISTON FULLY EXPOSED TO UNNECESSARY HYDRAULIC PRESSURES. IT IS EXACTLY AT THIS JUNCTURE WHERE A SERIOUS FRACTURE OCCURS ON THE PISTON, RENDERING THE BRAKE DANGEROUSLY INOPERABLE. MOREOVER, THE POSSIBILITY OF THE RUPTURED PARTICLES CAN FALL IN BETWEEN THE ROTORS AND THE ASSEMBLY, WHICH WOULD CAUSE A VEHICLE TO PITCH AND OVERTURN DUE TO THE PRINCIPLES OF PHYSICS. CHRYSLER HAS MANY OF THESE DEPLOYED ON THE ROAD IN VARIOUS MODELS OF AUTOS AN VANS. THIS IS FAR TOO DANGEROUS AN AFTERMARKET PRODUCT TO ALLOW THE PRODUCERS TO CONTINUE FLOODING THESE MARKETS WITH FLAWED DESIGN TO BEGIN WITH, AND A SERIOUSLY FLAWED   REPLACEMENT CYLINDER. AS A PILOT AND AIRCRAFT OWNER I WOULD TELL YOU THAT THE FAA, WOULD NEVER PERMIT SUCH A DESING ON AN AIRCRAFT. HAVING HAD MANY EXTENSIVE YEARS OF EXPERTISE ON BOTH AIRCRAFT AND AUTOMOTIVE REBUILDING-THESE BRAKE UNITS SHOULD BE TAKEN OFF THE MARKET AND A SUITABLE REPLACEMENT SHOULD BE MANDATED BY THE DOT. THE CHANGES NECESSARY TO ACCOMPLISH THIS ARE QUITE SIMPLE AND WOULD BE EFFECTIVE. I WOULD LIKE TO SEE THE ENGINEERING DOCUMENTS SHOWING THE REQUIRED TESTS PERFORMED BY THESE AFTERMARKET BRAKE ASSEMBLY PRODUCER. MY SUSPICION IS THAT THERE IS LITTLE OR NO INFORMATION OTHER THAN A "WHITE SHEET" INTRODUCED IN THIS MATTER. I CAN ASSURE YOU THAT CONSIDERING THE SHEER VOLUME OF THESE INNEFFICIENT AND FLAWED SYSTEMS THAT THE POSSIBILITY THAT MANY MAY HAVE.

AS NEAR AS I CAN TELL, THE PROBLEM IS RELATED TO ONE OR MORE TSBS THAT HAVE BEEN ISSUED.  BUT IT APPEARS TO BE SPECIFICALLY RELATED TO TSB #676303 - PHANTOM STALLS AT CLOSED THROTTLE AND HIGH ENGINE LOAD.  THIS PROBLEM POSES A SERIOUS SAFETY THREAT.  IN DETAIL WHAT HAPPENS IS THAT THE ENGINE STALLS WHEN YOU APPROACH AN INTERSECTION AND ARE SHIFTING DOWN, USING BRAKES, AND TURNING.  WHEN THE ENGINE QUITS IN A TURN, THE POWER STEERING QUITS.  ANYONE WITH SLOW REACTIONS OR LACKING THE PHYSICAL STRENGTH TO STEER THE CAR WITHOUT POWER IS IN FOR A SERIOUS ACCIDENT.  THE PROBLEM IS ESPECIALLY TROUBLING BECAUSE IT IS INTERMITTENT.  MY MECHANIC SAYS  "WE'LL JUST HAVE TO WAIT UNTIL IT QUITS COMPLETELY TO FIND OUT WHAT IT IS."  I CERTAINLY BELIEVE THAT ANY DEFECT SUCH AS THIS IS AN EXTREME HAZARD TO THE DRIVER AND PASSENGERS OF THIS CAR AS WELL AS ANYONE ELSE ON THE STREETS AT THE TIME.

WHILE DRIVING ON THE ROAD AT 65 MPH, THE HEADLIGHTS FAILED;THE DRIVING LIGHTS ALSO FAILED AT THE SAME TIME. I CHECKED WITH THE MANUFACTURER ABOUT A RECALL FOR THIS PROBLEM AND THERE WAS NONE LISTED FOR THIS YEAR. THERE WAS A RECALL FOR SIMILAR PROBLEM THAT ONLY WENT BACK TO THE 1994 MODEL.  THE SERVICE MANAGER AT DEALRSHIP INFORMED ME THAT THIS WAS A FAIRLY COMMON OCCURANCE IN GRAND PRIXS,OLDS CUTLESS,AND WHATEVER THE BUICK MODEL BASED ON THE SAME PLATFORM IS. THEY INDICATED THAT IT IS A FAULTY HI/LOW BEAM SWITCH IN THE STALK WITH THE CRUISE CONTROL. APPARENTLY NOT ENOUGH OF THESE HAVE BEEN REPORTED IN MY MODEL YEAR TO EFFECT A RECALL, BUT THAT DOESN'T MAKE IT ANY LESS DANGEROUS TO DRIVE.

I ENTERED MY AUTO ON THE EVENING OF 10/4/00 AT 8:10PM AND TURNED KEY TO START.  I DID NOT AT ANY TIME DEPRESS GAS PEDAL.  AFTER ENGINE STARTED, I ALLOWED RPM'S TO SETTTLE DOWN AND PUT MY FOOT ON THE BRAKE.  PUT TRANSMISSION IN "REVERSE" AND LET UP ON THE BRAKE.  THE IMMEDIATELY STARTED MOVING IN REVERSE IN AN UNCONTROLLED ACCELERATION (S?).  I SET MY FOOT ON THE BRAKE AND THERE WAS NO RESPONSE.  THE BRAKE PEDAL DID NOT MOVE.  THE CAR KEPT SPEEDING UP UNTIL IT HIT A TREE, BROADSIDE.  THE TOTAL DISTANCE WAS ABOUT 20-25 FEET, BUT THE CAR WAS "TOTALLED."  THIS IS THE 2ND TIME THIS HAS HAPPENED, EXCEPT ON THE PREVIOUS OCCASION, THE AUTO STOPPED IN ABOUT 3 FEET.  TWO TIMES SINCE THE PURCHASE OF THE AUTO, I HAVE HAD TO STOP SUDDENLY AND, IT SEEMED TO ME, THAT THE BRAKES WORKED THE WAY ABS BRAKES ARE SUPPOSE TO, BUT I'M NOT SURE.  A WITNESS WHO SAW THE ACCIDENT ESTIMATED THAT THE AUTOMOBILE WAS RACING IN REVERSE ABOUT 20-30 MPH,BEFORE IT STRUCK THE TREE,  BUT ONLY A GUESS. (DOT NUMBER: N/A  TIRESIZE: N/A)

I WAS DRIVING DOWN A MAIN ROAD (SPEED LIMIT 55 MPH) WHEN MY STEERING WENT COMPLETELY OUT, THE STEERING WHEEL SPUN IN EITHER DIRECTION WITHOUT STOPPING W/NO ACTION AT TIRES.  LUCKILY I WAS ABLE TO BRAKE AND MANEUVER THE VEHICLE TO THE SHOULDER.  UPON FURTHER INVESTIGATION I REALIZED THE ONLY REASON I WAS ABLE TO MANEUVER THE VEHICLE TO THE SHOULDER BY PRESSING THE BRAKES IS BECAUSE THE DRIVERS SIDE REAR CRADLE BOLT ON THE DRIVERS SIDE WAS MISSING WHICH CAUSED THE ENGINE AND ENTIRE FRONT END TO DROP AND TWIST TO THE RIGHT WHEN THE BRAKE WAS APPLIED.  THERE ARE  MANY VEHICLE TRAFFIC DEATHS ON THIS ROAD EVERY YEAR AND LUCKILY I WASN'T ANOTHER STATISTIC.  MY REASON BEHIND THIS COMPLAINT IS I HAVE NOTICED THAT THE NHTSA HAS ISSUED A RECALL ON THIS PROBLEM (CAMPAIGN #00V189000).  UPON LEARNING THIS I TOOK THE VEHICLE UP TO THE DEALER TO REMEDY THE PROBLEM AND WAS INFORMED THAT THE VEHICLE DID NOT FALL UNDER THE RECALL BECAUSE THE VIN # IS ONE NUMBER OFF (I.E. PONTIAC ISSUED THE RECALL FOR VINS UP TO MF23 AND MY VIN IS MF24).  THIS INFORMATION IS LOCATED ON GM'S DOCUMENT, ID# 792186.  MY COMPLAINT IS THIS:  THE PROBLEM HAS OCCURRED TO MY CAR, I LIVE IN MICHIGAN, IT'S A 1991, I COULD HAVE LOST MY LIFE AND I FEEL IT'S ALL ATTRIBUTED TO POOR ENGINEERING ON GM'S BEHALF, THEY HAVE RECOGNIZED THAT, BUT FOR THE SAKE OF SAVING MONEY, MY VEHICLE (ONE NUMBER OFF ON THE VIN), WAS NOT INCLUDED ON THE RECALL, YET THE PROBLEM STILL EXISTS.  THE SERVICE DEPARTMENT WAS VERY COMBATIVE WHEN ADDRESSING MY PROBLEM AND NOT VERY CONCERNED, EVEN THOUGH IT COULD OF BEEN ONE OF THEIR WIVES OR DAUGHTERS I CRASHED HEAD ON INTO BECAUSE OF POOR ENGINEERING AND AN OBVIOUS PROBLEM THAT WAS NOT COMPLETELY ADDRESSED IN ALL GRAND PRIXS THAT WERE MANUFACTURED IN 1991 AND REGISTERED IN THE STATE OF MICHIGAN.  *TR

AFTER APPROXIMATELY 150 MILES LATER, THE AIRBAG WARNING LIGHT CAME ON AND I CALLED PORSCHE WHO NOW REFUSES TO DO ANYTHING. I LIVE OVER 5 HOURS FROM THE NEAREST DEALER AND I AM AFRAID TO DRIVE THE CAR TO THE DEALER TO BE LOOKED AT. I ALSO FEEL SINCE THEY SUPPOSEDLY REPLACED THE SYSTEM, THE WARNING LIGHT BEING ON IS RELATED TO WHATEVER THEY DID. THE ONLY WAY I FOUND TO CORRECT THIS PROBLEM WAS TO PUT THE CAR INTO NEUTRAL, IF DISTANCE ALLOWED, AND ALLOW THE CAR TO DECOMPRESS BEFORE ACCELERATING.  A VERY LITTLE PERCENTAGE OF MY DRIVING INVOLVES THIS TYPE OF OFFRAMP, AND ESTIMATES I REQUESTED FOR THIS REPAIR RANGED CLOSE TO $1000.00.  MY HUSBAND ONCE HEARD A MAN CALL INTO AN AUTO-REPAIR RADIO STATION INTERVIEW WITH THE IDENTICAL PROBLEM IN HIS SUBARU LOYALE WAGON.  MY AXLE PROBLEM HAS BEEN A REAL NUISANCE. The contact owns a 1991 Subaru Loyale equipped with a replacement CV-axle from Master Pro, Part Number: SB8003. The contact indicated that while driving in reverse, the vehicle suddenly stopped moving and would not drive forward or backwards. The vehicle was towed to the residence and examined by an independent mechanic who diagnosed that the CV-axle had failed and needed to be replaced. The vehicle was not yet repaired. The manufacturer and local dealer were notified of the failure, but no assistance was offered. The contact indicated that the failure had also occurred on a second vehicle using the same part. The failure mileage was unknown.

The contact owns a 1991 Subaru Loyale. The contact stated that while driving at an undisclosed speed, the automatic seat belt continuously opened and retracted independently, failing to secure the contact inside the vehicle. The check engine warning light was illuminated. The vehicle was taken to the dealer, who diagnosed a failure with the automatic seat belt tightener system and observed an oil gasket leak. The vehicle was not repaired. The manufacturer was not notified of the failure. The failure mileage was 309,000.

OEM STANDARD TIRES ARE 225/75R15 ON TOYOTA STEEL WHEELS. OEM FACTORY OPTION TIRES ARE W/31X10.5 ON TOYOTA BRAND ALUMINUM WHEELS. THE FACTORY OFFICIAL STICKER SHOWS THE OPTION TIRES AS FACTORY-INSTALLED. THE DRIVER DOOR PILLAR STICKER SHOWS THE FACTORY-INSTALLED TIRE AS 225/75R15. THE PILLAR STICKER IS WRONG DUE TO DEFECT IN THE MANUFACTURING PROCESS. IN RELIANCE ON THE PILLAR STICKER, A TIRE TECHNICIAN INSTALLED REPLACEMENT TIRES BASED ON THE STANDARD SIZE. THE STANDARD TIRE IS SIGNIFICANTLY SMALLER IN DIAMETER THAN THE FACTORY OPTION TIRE. SAFETY ISSUES: 1) SPEEDOMETER ERROR ~10%, CAUSING MISMATCH TO POSTED LIMIT AND FORESEEABLE TAILGATING AND OTHER ADVERSE BEHAVIORS BY SURROUNDING DRIVERS; 2) DEGRADED STABILITY ON HIGH-CENTER OF GRAVITY SUV DUE TO  MISMATCH BETWEEN FACTORY OPTION SPARE TIRE AND REPLACEMENT TIRES BASED ON ERRONEOUS PILLAR STICKER.  *TR

THEY REQUESTED IT BE BROUGHT, IN SHOWING NO INTEREST IN THE SAFETY HAZARD OF DRIVING WITH AN INOPERABLE SEATBELT. I HAD AN INDEPENDENT TOYOTA TECHNICIAN LOOK AT TO NO AVAIL. I NEXT SEARCHED THE NHTSA WEB SITE AND FOUND SEVERAL OTHER CARS SIMILAR TO MINE WITH THE SAME PROBLEM. I CONTACTED TOYOTA CUSTOMER SERVICE TO GET HELP. THEY ASSURED ME THIS WAS IMPORTANT TO THEM. I FINALLY GOT THE CAR TO FRED ANDERSON. THEY DIAGNOSED THE PROBLEM AS A WORN DOOR LOCK ASSEMBLY. I ORDERED THE PART FOR ~$159. WHEN THE PART CAME IN, I ARRANGED AN APPOINTMENT TO GET IT FIXED. I BROUGHT THE CAR IN AND THEY WERE UNABLE/UNWILING TO FIX IT AS SCHEDULED. SO, I TOOK THE CAR BACK TO THE INDEPENDENT SHOP. NORTH CAROLINA HAS MANDATORY AUTO SAFETY INSPECTIONS. THIS CAR WAS DUE FOR AN INSPECTION IN JULY AND WOULD HAVE CERTAINLY FAILED WITHOUT A WORKING SEATBELT. THE TOTAL COST TO DIAGNOSE/FIX THIS PROBLEM : ~$370.*AK

RE:  NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER: - 93V147000. I WAS DRIVING HOME LISTENING TO THE RADIO WHEN IT STOPPED WORKING.  WHEN I REMOVED THE RADIO FROM THE CAR I FOUND A SSCP03 TAG DATED 07/13/94 WITH DEALER CODE NO "78" STAMPED ON IT.  SSCP03 IS THE TECHNICAL SERVICE BULLETIN (TSB) NUMBER I FOUND FOR A "SAFETY RECALL" .TODAY I WENT TO THE DEALERSHIP, AT WHICH I HAD PURCHASED THE CAR, TO INVESTIGATE THIS.  THE DEALERSHIP REPRESENTATIVE PRESENTED ME WITH A PAGE OF A "WARRANTY DOFU/SSC REPORT" ITEMIZING A     "P03   1991 CAMRY/PREVIA RADIO    08/24/94   31027"    FOR MY VEHICLE.  IT WAS EXPLAINED TO ME THAT THIS SHOWED THAT THE RADIO    [TOYOTA 86120-03042...CE-2233TL1B SERIAL NO. R7002084]    WAS FACTORY REPAIRED ON 07/13/94 AND INSTALLED IN THE VEHICLE ON 08/29/94, SATISFYING THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE SAFETY RECALL.  I AM CONCERNED THAT: THIS RADIO CEASED TO FUNCTION SUDDENLY; THE SSCP03 IDENTIFICATION APPEARS ON IT; AND, THOSE DATES PRECEED THE ISSUE DATE "SEP 94" OF THE SAFETY RECALL IDENTIFIED BY ALLDATA.COM. *AK

Summary: I WAS TRAVELING TOWARD KOKOMO, INDIANA, RETURNING HOME FROM A DR'S APPOINTMENT WITH MY SERVICE DOG, GAMSBY.  THERE WAS A HARLEY_DAVIDSON TRAILER TRUCK WITH A MICHIGAN LICENSE PLATE IN FRONT OF ME.  A LARGE METAL L SHAPED BAR FLEW FROM UNDER THE TRAILER AND UNDER MY CAR, SENDING IT INTO A SPIN AND TEARING UP THE BOTTOM OF THE CAR.  MY CAR IS NO LONGER OPERATIONAL FOR TRIPS OUT OF TOWN. I TRIED TO TALK WITH THE HARLEY DAVIDSON COMPANY AND THEY CLAIMED NO RESPONSIBILITY.  I AM A COLLEGE TEACHER, DISABLED AND BOTH ME AND MY SEIZURE DOG WERE INJURED.  HARLEY-DAVIDSON'S CORPORATE OFFICE BRUSHED US OFF LIKE DIRT.  IT IS HARD ENOUGH TO SURVIVE WITH MEDICAL BILLS AND LITTLE INCOME.  NOW MY DOG IS HAVING SEIZURES (PROBABLY DUE TO HIS HEAD HITTING THE DASH IN THE CRASH) AND DO NOT HAVE A SAFE CAR TO DRIVE.  I KNOW LIFE IS NOT FAIR, BUT IN THIS CASE I THINK THE LARGER COMPANY FEELS THEY ARE ABOVE THE LAW. *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1991 TOYOTA CAMRY.  THE CONTACT TURNED THE IGNITION ON AND APPLIED PRESSURE TO THE ACCELERATOR PEDAL.  SHE THEN HEARD A LOUD NOISE COMING FROM UNDERNEATH THE HOOD.  SHE NOTICED UNDERNEATH THE HOOD THAT THE SPARK PLUG WIRE WAS DETACHED.  THERE WERE NO WARNING LIGHTS ILLUMINATED ON THE INSTRUMENT PANEL.  THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC AND THE HELICAL COIL WAS REPLACED.  THE CONTACT WAS CONCERNED OF THE SAFETY RISK INVOLVED.   THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 151,500.  UPDATE 09/10/08 *CW  THE SPARK PLUG BLEW OUT OF THE HEAD UPDATED 09/19/08. *JB

TL-THE  DRIVER OWNED A 1991 TOYOTA CAMRY.  WHILE DRIVING 90 MPH THE VEHICLE ACCELERATED AND THE VEHICLE CRASHED INTO A TREE.  A POLICE REPORT WAS FILED. THE DRIVER WAS KILLED.  THE VEHICLE WAS DESTROYED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS UNKNOWN.  VWB   UPDATED 06/24/10 *BF   ACCORDING TO THE POLICE REPORT, THE CONSUMER WAS TRAVELING AT A HIGH RATE OF SPEED. THE CONSUMER SLID OFF THE ROAD TO THE LEFT AND THEN SLID BACK OFF THE ROAD TO THE RIGHT AND BEGAN TO ROLL TO ITS LEFT. THE VEHICLE THEN STRUCK A TREE AND SEPARATED. THE BACK HALF CAME TO REST FACING NORTH ON ITS LEFT SIDE AGAINST THE TREE. THE FRONT OF THE VEHICLE CAME TO REST BEHIND THE TREE FACING NORTH.  UPDATED 06/25/10.*JB  UPDATED 01/12/11*LJ  THE INJURED BOX WAS ALSO CHECKED. UPDATED 02/07/11

SHORTLY AFTER INSTALLING A SPECTRA PREMIUM REPLACEMENT FUEL TANK ON MY 1991 CAMRY, THE VENT TUBE LEAKED FUEL AND VAPORS DUE TO A DEFECT IN THE JOINT WHERE THE VAPOR TUBE IS SOLDERED TO THE TANK. A HAIRLINE CRACK AT THIS JOINT WAS EITHER PRESENT AT MANUFACTURE, OR DEVELOPED SOON AFTER INSTALL, THROUGH WHICH SIGNIFICANT VAPOROUS AND LIQUID GASOLINE ESCAPED. THIS IS A FIRE AND EXPLOSION HAZARD AS WELL AS A HEALTH AND AIR POLLUTION HAZARD. I CALLED SPECTRA PREMIUM TO ALERT THEM TO THIS AND THEY REFUSED TO ASSIST ME AND DID NOT RETURN PHONE CALLS AND MESSAGES. THE COMPANY BASICALLY JUST BLEW ME OFF AND SEEMS TO CARE LESS ABOUT A SERIOUS SAFETY PROBLEM. I HAD TO USE TWO PART EPOXY TO SEAL THE HAIRLINE CRACK AS AN INTERIM FIX.  *TR

MY CAR WAS WELL MAINTAINED.  IT WAS PARKED IN THE SUN ON A WARM (80 DEGREE) DAY AS USUAL.  I GOT IN MY CAR AND EVEN BEFORE I PUT MY KEY IN THE IGNITION I HEARD A STATIC/CRACKLING SOUND COMING FROM THE REAR SPEAKERS.  IT DIDN'T OCCUR TO ME RIGHT AWAY THAT THE CAR ENGINE WAS OFF SO I SHOULD NOT HAVE HEARD THE RADIO AT ALL.  AS I STARTED THE CAR I HIT THE RADIO BUTTON THINKING THE RADIO WAS ON BUT HAD LOST THE STATION.  THE NOISE DID NOT GO AWAY WHEN I HIT THE BUTTON AND I REALIZED THE CAR WAS FILLING WITH SMOKE, COMING FROM INSIDE THE UPPER DASH (AREA OF RADIO) IN THE FRONT OF THE CAR.  I IMMEDIATELY PULLED OVER AND SHUT THE ENGINE OFF AND GOT OUT OF THE CAR.  SMOKE CONTINUED TO COME FROM THE AIR VENTS.  IT SEEMED TO HAVE A ELECTRICAL BURNING SMELL (I'VE WORKED IN LABS AND STARTED A FEW MYSELF...) VERSUS A GAS OR OIL OR OTHER BURNING SMELL.  WHEN THE SMOKE CLEARED, I CHECKED THE REST OF THE ELECTRICAL SYSTEM AND THE LIGHTS AND AIR CONDITIONING AND DIGITAL CLOCK WORKED FINE.  THE CAR REALLY DOESN'T HAVE ANY MUCH ELSE I COULD CHECK, NO ELECTRIC DOOR LOCKS, ETC.  I PULLED THE RADIO FUSE.  IT WAS NOT BLOWN.  I STARTED THE CAR WITH FRIENDS WATCHING AND THE ENGINE APPEARED TO BE FINE.  I WAS ABLE TO DRIVE HOME A 5 MILE RIDE WITH NO APPARENT PROBLEM.  THE RADIO/CASSETTE PLAYER WERE INSTALLED WHEN I BOUGHT THE CAR.  I USE IT ALL THE TIME AND NEVER HAD PROBLEMS BEFORE.  MY CONCERN HERE IS COULD THE CAR HAVE CAUGHT FIRE JUST SITTING IN THE PARKING LOT OR AT ANY OTHER TIME FROM THIS ELECTRICAL (?) PROBLEM?  THIS COULD HAVE BEEN DANGEROUS HAD I BEEN ON A MAIN ROAD WITH MY YOUNG CHILD STRAPPED IN THE CAR SEAT.  THE RADIO WAS CRACKLING WITHOUT THE KEY EVEN IN THE IGNITION, SO SOMETHING WAS GOING ON EVEN BEFORE I GOT IN THE CAR.  THANK YOU FOR TAKING THIS REPORT.  *AK

THE EXHAUST MANIFOLD CRACKED FOR NO APPARENT REASON AND HAD TO BE REPLACED, WHICH COST ABOUT $400. FROM THE INFORMATION THAT I HAVE FOUND, THERE HAVE BEEN QUITE A FEW PEOPLE WHO HAVE HAD THE SAME PROBLEM WITH THE EXHAUST MANIFOLD FOR THIS MODEL. *AK

PLUS THEN TOYOTA CHARGES OVER TWICE AS MUCH FOR REPLACEMENT PANS THAN OTHER VEHICLE MANUFACTURERS.  IT JUST SEEMS AS IF TOYOTA IS USING THIS AS A  CASH COW.  *AK

AFTER BUYING A USED 1991 TOYOTA COROLA I NOTICED 3 OUT OF 5 SEAT BELTS IN THIS CAR  WERE  DEFECTIVE. THE RETRACTOR ON THE SEAT BELTS DID  NOT LATCH WHEN I PULLED ON IT QUICKLY. MY WIFE AND I DID NOT EVEN NOTICE WHEN WE WERE TEST DRIVING THE CAR. THEY APPEARED TO BE FINE. I BELIEVE THERE  WERE  MANY OF THESE CARS ON THE ROAD.  THESE SEAT BELTS  WERE JUNK AND NEEDED TO BE RECALLED BY TOYOTA, AND THEY NEED TO REPLACE THEM WITH PROPERLY WORKING ONES FREE OF CHARGE BEFORE PEOPLE GET HURT OR KILLED. I CALLED TOYOTA AND ASKED THEM TO FIX THEM FREE OF CHARGE. THEY TOLD ME THEY WILL NOT BECAUSE IT WAS  OUT OF WARRANTY.  THIS WAS  A VERY URGENT SAFETY ISSUE.   TOYOTA NEEDS TO FIX THEM FREE OF CHARGE. I CALLED A TOYOTA DEALER, AND THEY WANT $600 FOR 3 SETS OF SEAT BELTS, AND  THAT DID NOT  NOT EVEN INCLUDE  LABOR TO INSTALL THEM. TO MAKE THINGS WORSE THEY  WERE  EXTREMELY DIFFICULT TO WORK ON. THEY MADE IT  DIFFICULT ON PURPOSE SO THAT THE CONSUMERS GOT  STUCK WITH A HUGE BILLS IF THEY WANTED THE SEAT BELTS FIXED. I WISH TO HAVE AN INVESTIGATION ON THIS MATTER. *AK

MY CAR ACCELERATED ON REVERSE WHEREIN INSTEAD OF MAKING A 90 DEGREES ANGLE THE CAR WENT SWIPING IN 180 DEGREES. BOTH TIMES WAS RAINY. BOTH TIMES I WAS MAKING A REVERSE LEFT SIDE CORNER. WHEN I BOUGHT THIS CAR THE LEFT BACKLIGHT IS DAMAGED. I PUT THINGS TOGETHER THAT MAYBE THE SAME THING HAD HAPPEN TO THE FIRST OWNER OF MY CAR. I HAVE DRIVEN IN ALL OVER THE WORLD FOR 18 YEARS, WITHOUT ANY ACCIDENT HAPPENED TO ME IN THE HIGHWAYS BUT THE ONLY TWO ACCIDENT I HAVE WITH SO FAR IS ON THIS CAR IN MY OWN BACKYARD, ON THE SAME EXACT MOTION, SAME WEATHER CONDITION. THE CAR WAS ON REVERSE. THE TWO TIMES IT HAPPENED WAS VERY IDENTICAL TO EACH OTHER.

I COULDN'T FEEL IF IT DOES..BUT COUPLE WEEKS AGO I  OBSERVED IT VERY CLOSELY.AND YES IT DOES SWERVED. I WOULD LIKE TO ADD TO THE LIST OF MY PREVIOUS COMPLAINT THAT THE SECOND TIME THAT MY CAR ACCELERATED IN REVERSE MOTION  COULD ALSO BE ATTRIBUTED TO STEERING MECHANISM. WHY ? I WAS ENGAGED IN REVERSE , WHILE CUTTING THE WHEEL  TO MAKE A 90 DEGREES ANGLE BACKING BUT MY CAR WENT INTO A DONUT SPIN. AS A WOMAN WHAT DO I KNOW ABOUT CARS. ALL I KNOW IS THAT IT IS TOO IRONIC THAT THE SIMILARITIES OF THESE INCIDENTS ARE TOO FARFETCH TO IGNORE. THEY ARE IDENTICAL TO EACH OTHER. I AM SCARED TO RIDE IN IT SINCE THEN. I REMEMBER THE FIRST CAR I HAVE WAS A CELICA,THAT TOO CROSS A MIDDLE ISLAND WHILE I WAS MAKING A U TURN. AND THE RUST INSIDE MY TRUNK . WHY WOULD THE RUST IS INSIDE THE TRUNK. THE SEATBELT DOESN'T WORK. THE SEAT ARE TOO LOW THAT IF I DON'T REINFORCE IT WITH PADDED PILLOWS I COULD HARDLY SEE THE FRONT & THE BACK. I SPEND SO MUCH MONEY ON THIS CAR BECAUSE I GET ATTACHED TO IT. ALSO THE HEADLIGHTS I HAVE CHANGED IT LIKE YOU WON'T BELIEVED. *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1991 TOYOTA COROLLA DX SEDAN. THE CONTACT STATED HE WAS ATTEMPTING TO PARK AT 3 MPH. THE BRAKES WERE DEPRESSED AND THE VEHICLE ABNORMALLY ACCELERATED. THE CONTACT APPLIED MORE PRESSURE TO THE BRAKE BUT THE VEHICLE CONTINUED TO ACCELERATE MORE RAPIDLY. THE CONTACT THEN ENGAGED THE EMERGENCY BRAKE BUT TO NO AVAIL. THE VEHICLE THEN INDEPENDENTLY DECREASED IN SPEED BEFORE COMING TO A STOP. THE DEALER ADVISED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS NOT UNDER RECALL AND DIRECTED HIM TO CONTACT THE MANUFACTURER TO REPORT THE FAILURE. THE MANUFACTURER LODGED THE CONTACT'S COMPLAINT BUT DID NOT OFFER ANY FURTHER ASSISTANCE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT HE HAD EXPERIENCED UNINTENDED ACCELERATION IN THE VEHICLE ONE YEAR PRIOR TO THE MOST RECENT FAILURE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE FAILURE AND CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 89,800.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1991 TOYOTA COROLLA. THE CONTACT STATED THAT DURING THE COLD WEATHER, SHE WAS UNABLE TO UNLOCK HER DOOR FROM THE INSIDE. THE CONTACT STATED DUE TO THE COLD, AND THAT THE DOOR LOCK DID NOT HAVE RIDGES, SHE WAS UNABLE TO PULL THE LOCK IN THE UPWARD POSITION AND EXIT THE VEHICLE. THE CONTACT WAS TRAPPED INSIDE OF THE VEHICLE UNTIL LAW ENFORCEMENT ARRIVED AND UNLOCKED THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT TAKEN TO THE DEALER FOR INSPECTION. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE . THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 200,000. THE VIN WAS UNAVAILABLE.

THE HEAD GASKET FAILED CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE ENGINE COMPONENTS WHEN ENGINE OVERHEATED, CONSUMER HAS OWNER TWO OTHER TOYOTA CRESSIDAS (1982 AND 1990) WHICH EXPERIENCED THE SAME HEAD GASKET FAILURES.
AIR FLOW (VENTILLATION) FAN FAILED.

DRIVING SOUTHBOUND ON A FL TURNPIKE.  THE TEMP. WAS 85 DEG. F. TRAVELING AT ABOUT 80 MPH (GENERAL TRAFFIC WAS TRAVELING AT THAT SPEED).  A COUPLE ON IN A TRUCK WAS INDICATING THAT SOMETHING WAS WRONG WITH OUR CAR (THEY ACUALLY STATED THAT OUR CAR WAS ON FIRE).  THE CAR WAS HANDLING OK AT THE TIME AND THERE WERE NO UNUSUAL SMELLS.  I PULLED OVER INTO AN EXIT AS SOON AS THE WAY WAS CLEAR, AND WHEN I WENT TO APPLY BRAKES, THE BREAK PEDAL WENT TO THE FLOOR - THE CAR GRADUALLY CAME TO A STOP ON THE SHOULDER.  AS SOON AS I GOT OUT OF THE CAR, A PLUME OF BLACK SMOKE STARTED TO BILLOW OUT OF THE FRONT OF THE HOOD.  I OPENED THE HOOD, PROPED IT OPEN - THE FIRE WAS CONCENTRATED ON THE RIGHT (PASSENGER) SIDE OF THE ENGINE.  BY THE TIME THE FIRE DEPARTMENT HAD THE FIRE EXTINGUISHED, THE CAR WAS A TOTAL LOSS (THEY HAD ARRIVED ON THE SCENE WITHIN 15 MINUTES).  BECAUSE OF RECENT INFORMATION  ON THE INTERNET, I'VE BECOME AWARE THAT OTHER PEOPLE ARE EXPERIENCING THE SAME PROBLEM WITH THEIR '1991-'1992 CRESSIDAS.  APARENTLY,  THERE IS A PROBLEM WITH THE HEAD GASKETS FAILING AT SOME POINT AFTER 100K MILES, CAUSING OIL TO LEAK PAST THE GASKET ONTO THE HOT MANIFOLD ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE ENGINE.  WHEN I STARTED THE READ THESE REPORTS, THIS INCIDENT BEGAN TO MAKE SENSE.  I MAINTAINED OUR CAR VERY CONSCIENTIOUSLY, FOCUSING ON PREVENTITIVE MAINTENANCE TO KEEP IT IN EXCELLENT RUNNING ORDER.  UP TO THIS POINT OUR CRESSIDA HAS PROVEN VERY RELIABLE AND WE HAD BEEN VERY HAPPY OWNERS.. *AK
THE CONSUMER HAS BEEN HAVING PROBLEMS WITH EMISSION, ALL THE SMOKE GETS INSIDE VEHICLE WHILE VEHICLE IS DRIVEN, BUT NOT AT ALL TIME.  *AK

FIRESTONE , FIREHAWK TIRES  ARE NOT  ORIGINAL TIRES ON A TOYOTA, CRESSIDA, 1991, P205/60R15, DOTVDUNJBBO.   WHILE TRAVELING AT 75 TO 80 MPH VEHICLE STARTED TO SHAKE VERY BADLY.    PULLED OVER TO SHOULDER AND NOTICED LEFT FRONT TIRE TREAD HAD COME COMPLETELY OFF. HOWEVER,  TIRE WAS STILL INFLATED.*AK  MILEAGE AT PURCHASE OF THE TIRES WAS 63000 MILES, TIRE HAD 18425 MILES AT TIME OF FAILURE.  *SLC

DT:  CONSUMER  OWNED A 1991 TOYOTA CRESSIDA.  THERE WAS A HUMMER PM525 MUFFLER, MANUFACTURED BY PILOT MOTOR SPORTS INSTALLED ON THE VEHICLE AFTER PURCHASE.  THE HEAT FROM THE MUFFLER CAUSED THE REAR BUMPER TO CATCH ON FIRE.  IT BURNT THE WHOLE BACK OF THE VEHICLE AND THE VEHICLE WAS  TOTALED.  THIS OCCURRED ON AUGUST 1, 2005  CONSUMER THOUGHT  THE MUFFLER WAS INSTALLED A YEAR EARLIER.   THIS VEHICLE HAD BEEN INOPERABLE FOR APPROXIMATELY A YEAR;  CONSUMER WAS REBUILDING THE ENGINE.  THE CONSUMER TOOK THE VEHICLE FOR A DRIVE; HE CAME HOME AND PARKED THE VEHICLE.  WHEN HE CAME OUT, APPROXIMATELY 10 HOURS LATER, HE NOTICED THE VEHICLE WAS BURNT.*AK
LUG NUTS BROKE, CAUSING WHEEL TO COME OFF VEHICLE.
THIN 12 GUAGE WIRE INSTALLED WHERE A THICKER 10 GUAGE WIRE SHOULD BE. THE NARROWER GUAGE CAUSES ELECTRONIC FUEL INJECTION RELAY TO OVERHEAT AND BURN OUT.  THE FIX WAS TO INSTALL 10 GUAGE WIRE.
ODOMETER FRAUD.

THE MIRRORS ARE DEFECTIVE.  I HAVE SPOKEN TO SEVEN LAND CRUISER OWNERS AND ALL HAVE HAD THE SAME PROBLEM WITH THE SIDEVIEW MIRRORS.  THEY ARE STRUCTURALLY UNSOUND.  THE PLASTIC PART INSIDE BREAKS IN THREE DIFFERENT AREAS--TWO LITTLE ATTACHMENTS NEAR THE TOP AND THE SCREW HOLE AT THE BOTTOM (IT STRIPS OUT AND SPLITS).  I HAVE TALKED TO TOYOTA ABOUT THIS YET THERE IS NO TYPE OF ASSISTANCE ON THEIR PART.  I CONTACTED NUMEROUS USED PARTS DEALERS AS WELL AS TOYOTA PARTS DEPARTMENTS AND THEY ALL CONFIRMED THAT THIS IS A VERY COMMON PROBLEM. *AK
CENTER INSIDE  OF REAR TAILGATE BENDS IN WITH NORMAL WEAR&TEAR COMPROMISING WEATHER SEAL AND ALLOWING EXAUST FUMES INTO PASSENGER CAB.*AK
ENGINE DIED WITHOUT WARNING.  VEHICLE TOWED TO TOYOTA DEALER.  DEALER HAS BEEN UNABLE TO DIAGNOSIS THE PROBLEM AFTER 2 WEEKS.*AK

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1991 TOYOTA LAND CRUISER. WHILE DRIVING 45 MPH HE APPLIED PRESSURE TO THE BRAKE PEDAL, BUT THE VEHICLE CONTINUED TO ACCELERATE. HE HAD TO SHUT THE ENGINE OFF TO DECELERATE AND CONTINUE DRIVING. ON SEPTEMBER 12, 2009 AFTER PARKING THE VEHICLE AND STEPPING OUT OF IT, THE VEHICLE ROLLED BACKWARDS. THE CONTACT WAS PINNED IN BETWEEN THE DOOR AND SEVERELY INJURED. HE WAS HOSPITALIZED FOR TEN DAYS AND PLACED IN A REHABILITATION UNIT. THE FAILURE AND CURRENT MILEAGES WERE 196000.

WHILE DRIVING AT APPROXIMATELY 35 MPH, CONSUMER HEARD A FLAPPING TYPE NOISE THAT SOUNDED LIKE A BELT HAD COME LOOSE.  THE VEHICLE IMMEDIATELY DIED.  CONSUMER WAS INFORMED THAT THE ENGINE HAD FROZEN IN THE EVENT THE VEHICLE HAD RAN OUT OF OIL, HOWEVER THERE WAS FRESH OIL IN THE VEHICLE AND NO SIGNS OF LACK OF OIL. FIFTH  GEAR STARTED MAKING A LOUD WHIRRING SOUND AT HIGHWAY SPEED.  STOPPED USING  THE FIFTH GEAR IN FEAR OF FAILURE AT HIGHWAY SPEED. HAD THE TRUCK LOOKED,  AND WAS TOLD BY THE GARAGE THAT SPECIALIZES IN TOYOTA VEHICLES  THAT TOYOTA PICKUPS FROM THE YEARS 1989 TO 1991 WERE NOTORIOUS FOR THIS PROBLEM.  I WENT BACK TO TALK TO THE MECHANIC AND WAS ASKED WHAT IT WAS DOING. I HAD  STARTED  TELLING HIM ABOUT THE FIFTH  GEAR NOISE WHEN HE INTERRUPTED ME AND ASKED IF THIRD  GEAR WAS GIVING ME PROBLEMS  TOO. I TOLD HIM YES. HE ASKED IF IT WOULD EVEN STAY IN GEAR ANYMORE,, AND I TOLD HIM NO, WHICH INDEED WAS THE PROBLEM.  THE TRANSMISSION HAD TO BE COMPLETELY REBUILT AT A COST OF $1,  *AK

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1991 TOYOTA PICKUP.  THE VEHICLE HAS UNIROYAL MOHAVE (NA) TIRES, SIZE P205/55/R15 (NA).  THE CONTACT NOTICED THAT THE TREAD BEGAN SEPARATING FROM ALL FOUR TIRES.  ON TWO OCCASIONS, THE TIRE COMPLETELY BLEW OUT.  DURING THE FIRST INCIDENT, WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 60 MPH, THE REAR DRIVER'S SIDE TIRE BLEW OUT AND DAMAGED THE VEHICLE.  DURING THE SECOND INCIDENT, THE CONTACT FELT THAT HIS VEHICLE WAS DRIVING EXTREMELY ROUGH.  HE TOOK THE VEHICLE TO THE DEALER AND THEY ROTATED THE TIRES.  THEY ALSO DISCOVERED THAT THE TREAD HAD ABNORMAL LESIONS.  THE CONTACT'S INSURANCE COMPANY INSPECTED THE TIRES AND CONCLUDED THAT THEY WERE MANUFACTURED DEFECTIVELY.  THE MANUFACTURER HAS NOT BEEN NOTIFIED.  THE CONTACT STILL HAS POSSESSION OF THE TIRES.  THE VIN AND MILEAGES WERE UNKNOWN.

Summary: TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1991 TOYOTA PICKUP.  THREE MONTHS AFTER THE VEHICLE WAS PURCHASED, THE CONTACT NOTICED EXTREME RUSTING ON THE CHASSIS UNDERNEATH THE VEHICLE. ALL TOYOTA EQUIPMENT DRIVE SHAFTS HAVE DESIGN DEFECTS ON PREVIA VANS-IF SHAFT IS NOT REPLACED OFTEN- COULD THROW METAL INTO CAB. USUALLY VIBRATION IS SO BAD, OWNER REPLACES SHAFT BEFORE HARM. THE RUBBER SPACERS THAT HOLD THIS SHAFT TOGETHER CANNOT HOLD TOGETHER BECAUSE OF STRESS OF POWER STEERING, AC COMPRESSOR, ALTERNATER AND FAN. THIS LIKELY PLAYED APART INTO THIS VEHICLE DISCONTINUATION. TWO DEALERS TELL ME THIS IS A PROBLEM AND THEY STAY BUSY REPLACING THIS. BUT MANUFACTURER SAYS THEY KNOW OF NO PROBLEMS.

Summary: ON A RETURN TRIP FROM CA. MY TOYOTA PREVIA JUST STOPPED RUNNING.  IT WOULD NOT START AGAIN SO HAD TO HAVE IT TOWED TO LAS VEGAS NV. ABOUT 50 MILES. IN TAKING THE VAN TO MY MECHANIC HE SAID THAT IT WAS TOTALLY OUT OF WATER AND ALMOST OUT OF OIL .THE FIRST PISTON HAS NO COMPRESION THE REST ARE BELOW 100 PUONDS.  THE VAN GAVE NO WARNING THAT IT WAS OUT OF WATER OR EVEN LOW ON OIL, ALSO THIS VAN HAS EXTRA OIL UP UNDER THE HOOD, AND IT HAS A PUMP THAT SHOULD HAVE PUMPED OIL INTO THE ENGINE, IT DID NOT IT FAILED.  ALSO THE WRANING GAUGE DID NOT INDICATE THAT THE ENGINE WAS OVERHEATING.  THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME RICH IN VEGAS.  *AK
DOOR COULD NOT BE OPENED- DEALER HAD TO REMOVE THE WHOLE DOOR.  *AK

WHILE DRIVING ON I-4 IN ORLANDO 12/7/00 AT 70 MPH  TREAD SEPARATED FROM OUR RIGHT REAR TIRE.  I WAS ABLE TO KEEP THE CAR UNDER CONTROL AND PULL INTO THE MEDIAN, BUT BY THEN THE SEPARATED TREAD HAD BEAT THE CAR UP.  I AM FILING A DAMAGE CLAIM NEXT WEEK WITH FIRESTONE, AND YESTERDAY REPLACED ALL OF THE TIRES WITH GOODRICHES.  THE FOUR YEAR OLD TIRE THAT FAILED HAD 52,00 MILES ON IT AND WAS WARRANTED FOR 60,000.  THERE WAS NO UNUSUAL TREAD WEAR PATTERN.  THE MANAGER OF THE FIRESTONE DEALERSHIP IN WINTER PARK, FL INSPECTED THE TIRE AND AGREED THE TREAD WAS IN GOOD CONDITION, AND THAT THERE WAS NO WAY TO HAVE FORSEEN THAT THE TIRE WOULD FAIL BEFORE THE WARRANTED MILEAGE OCCURRED.  HE DECLINED TO REPLACE ANY OF MY TIRES FOR FREE, ONLY OFFERING A 13% PRO-RATA CREDIT TOWARDS A NEW PURCHASE.  MY OFFICE # IS 407-237-4851.  I WILL PROBABLY MAIL THE TIRE TO FIRESTONE ON 12/18/00 AFTER PHOTOGRAPHING IT.*AK (DOT NUMBER: EJREDJD154  TIRESIZE: 20575R14)

IN MAY 2000, I HAD A PROBLEM WITH MY CAR EITHER NOT STARTING, AND IF IT DID START IT WOULD  STALL AT ANY TIME. THIS SEEMS SIMULAR TO THE INCIDENT WITH THE RECENT COURT ORDERED RECALL OF THE FORD VEHICLE WITH THE FAULTY IGNITION UNIT WHICH CAUSES THE CARS TO STALL AT ANY TIME. IN MY SITUATION, I WAS TOLD THAT THE PART THAT WAS ACTUALLY CAUSING THE PROBLEM COULD NOT BE ISOLATED DOWN TO A SINGLE ITEM. THE PROBLEM THAT I WAS HAVING WAS NEVER DUPLICATED BY THE VOLVO DEALER THAT LOOKED AT IT. THEY KNEW FROM EXPERIENCE THAT THE PROBLEM WAS ONE OF THREE COMPONENTS, THE FUEL PUMP RELAY - P/N 3523608, INJECTOR RELAY - P/N 1323592-1, AND THE ENGINE SPEED SENSOR - P/N 2719949. CHANGING THESE PARTS WAS A NORMAL PROCEDURE FOR THIS SITUATION, I WAS TOLD BY THE VOLVO SERVICE ADVISER.  AT THE TIME HE ALSO TOLD ME THAT THEY GET 3 TO 4 OF THESE PROBLEMS IN A MONTH, AND HE DIDN'T SEEM CONCERNED FOR THE POTENTIAL DANGER WITH THE CAR CUTTING OFF WHILE DRIVING, OR THE FACT THAT HE WAS CHANGING TWO PARTS THAT DIDN'T NEED TO BE CHANGED. LATER I WROTE THE MANAGER OF THE VOLVO DEALERSHIP REQUESTING A REFUND FOR THE TWO GOOD PARTS THAT WERE CHANGED AND GOT A REPLY FROM THE SAME SERVICE ADVISER. AT THIS TIME THE NUMBER OF TIMES THEY GET THIS PROBLEM PER MONTH ACCORDING TO HIM DROPPED TO 1 INSTEAD OF THE3 TO 4 PER MONTH THAT HE HAD CLAIMED BEFORE.  I POINTED OUT TO HIM THAT THE FACT THAT THE PART NEVER FAILS PERMENATELY IS CAUSE TO CONSIDER IT A DEFECTIVE PART. HE SAID THERE'S NOTHING IN THE BOOK THAT STATES THAT A PART HAS TO FAIL PERMENATELY. I RECOGNIZED THE POTENTIAL FOR DANGER THAT THIS SITUATION HAS FROM THE MOMENT I STARTED HAVING PROBLEMS, BUT DUE TO THE APATHY OF THE SERVICE ADVISER AND THE MANAGER AT THE VOLVO CENTER HERE I WAS HESITANT TO CONTACT NHTSA. SINCE THE JUDGE IN CALIFORNIA SEEMS TO THINK LIKE I DO, I'M NOW BRINGING THIS POTENTIAL PROBLEM TO YOUR ATTENTION. THIS IS THE BASICS OF MY COMPLAINT. PLEASE SEND ME ANY OTHER INFORMATION ON THIS SUBJECT THAT YOU MAY HAVE..
